proteusPy.DisulfideList

This module is part of the proteusPy package, a Python package for the analysis and modeling of protein structures, with an emphasis on disulfide bonds. This work is based on the original C/C++ implementation by Eric G. Suchanek.

The module provides the implmentation and interface for the DisulfideList object, used extensively by Disulfide class.

Author: Eric G. Suchanek, PhD Last revision: 2025-01-15 00:09:24 -egs-

 104class DisulfideList(UserList):
 105    """
 106    The class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects.
 107    Indexing and slicing are supported, as well as typical list operations like
 108    ``.insert()``, ``.append()`` and ``.extend().`` The DisulfideList object must be initialized
 109    with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name. Sorting is keyed by torsional energy.
 110
 111    The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the
 112    [display()](#DisulfideList.display) and [display_overlay()](#DisulfideList.display_overlay)methods.
 113    See below for examples.\n
 114
 115    Examples:
 116    >>> from proteusPy import Disulfide, DisulfideLoader, DisulfideList, Load_PDB_SS
 117
 118    Instantiate some variables. Note: the list is initialifzed with an iterable and a name (optional)
 119
 120    >>> SS = Disulfide('tmp')
 121
 122    The list is initialized with an iterable, a name and resolution. Name and resolution
 123    are optional.
 124    >>> SSlist = DisulfideList([],'ss', -1.0)
 125
 126    Load the database.
 127    >>> PDB_SS = Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True)
 128
 129    Get the first disulfide via indexing.
 130    >>> SS = PDB_SS[0]
 131
 132    # assert str(SS) == "<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>"
 133
 134    >>> SS4yys = PDB_SS['4yys']
 135
 136    # assert str(SS4yys) == "[<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>, <Disulfide 4yys_56A_98A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>, <Disulfide 4yys_156A_207A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>]"
 137
 138    Make some empty disulfides.
 139    >>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
 140    >>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')
 141
 142    Make a DisulfideList containing ss1, named 'tmp'
 143    >>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1], 'tmp')
 144    >>> sslist.append(ss2)
 145
 146    Extract the first disulfide
 147    >>> ss1 = PDB_SS[0]
 148
 149    # assert str(ss1.pprint_all()) == "<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å\n Proximal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 22, ' '))> Distal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 65, ' '))>\nProximal Coordinates:\n   N: <Vector -2.36, -20.48, 5.21>\n   Cα: <Vector -2.10, -19.89, 3.90>\n   C: <Vector -1.12, -18.78, 4.12>\n   O: <Vector -1.30, -17.96, 5.03>\n   Cβ: <Vector -3.38, -19.31, 3.32>\n   Sγ: <Vector -3.24, -18.40, 1.76>\n   Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>\n   Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>\n Distal Coordinates:\n   N: <Vector -0.60, -18.71, -1.62>\n   Cα: <Vector -0.48, -19.10, -0.22>\n   C: <Vector 0.92, -19.52, 0.18>\n   O: <Vector 1.10, -20.09, 1.25>\n   Cβ: <Vector -1.48, -20.23, 0.08>\n   Sγ: <Vector -3.22, -19.69, 0.18>\n   Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>\n   Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>\n<BLANKLINE>\n Proximal Internal Coords:\n   N: <Vector -0.41, 1.40, -0.00>\n   Cα: <Vector 0.00, 0.00, 0.00>\n   C: <Vector 1.50, 0.00, 0.00>\n   O: <Vector 2.12, 0.71, -0.80>\n   Cβ: <Vector -0.50, -0.70, -1.25>\n   Sγ: <Vector 0.04, -2.41, -1.50>\n   Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>\n   Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>\nDistal Internal Coords:\n   N: <Vector 1.04, -5.63, 1.17>\n   Cα: <Vector 1.04, -4.18, 1.31>\n   C: <Vector 1.72, -3.68, 2.57>\n   O: <Vector 1.57, -2.51, 2.92>\n   Cβ: <Vector -0.41, -3.66, 1.24>\n   Sγ: <Vector -1.14, -3.69, -0.43>\n   Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>\n   Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>\n Χ1-Χ5: 174.63°, 82.52°, -83.32°, -62.52° -73.83°, 138.89°, 1.70 kcal/mol\n Cα Distance: 4.50 Å\n Torsion length: 231.53 deg>"
 150
 151    Get a list of disulfides via slicing
 152    >>> subset = DisulfideList(PDB_SS[0:10],'subset')
 153
 154    Display the subset disulfides overlaid onto the same coordinate frame,
 155    (proximal N, Ca, C').
 156
 157    The disulfides are colored individually to facilitate inspection.
 158
 159    >>> subset.display_overlay()
 160    """
 161
 162    def __init__(self, iterable, pid: str = "nil", res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False):
 163        """
 164        Initialize the DisulfideList.
 165
 166        :param iterable: An iterable of disulfide bonds.
 167        :type iterable: iterable
 168        :param pid: Name for the list, default is "nil".
 169        :type pid: str
 170        :param res: Resolution, default is -1.0. If -1, the average resolution is used.
 171        :type res: float
 172        :param quiet: If True, suppress output, default is True.
 173        :type quiet: bool
 174        :param fast: If True, enable fast mode, default is False.
 175        :type fast: bool
 176
 177        Example:
 178        >>> from proteusPy import DisulfideList, Disulfide
 179
 180        Initialize some empty disulfides.
 181        >>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
 182        >>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')
 183        >>> ss3 = Disulfide('ss3')
 184
 185        Make a list containing the disulfides.
 186        >>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1, ss2], 'sslist')
 187        >>> sslist
 188        [<Disulfide ss1, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss2, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>]
 189        >>> sslist.append(ss3)
 190        >>> sslist
 191        [<Disulfide ss1, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss2, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss3, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>]
 192        """
 193
 194        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
 195
 196        self.pdb_id = pid
 197        self.quiet = quiet
 198
 199        if not fast:
 200            if res == -1:
 201                self._res = self.average_resolution
 202            else:
 203                self._res = res
 204        else:
 205            self._res = res
 206
 207    def __getitem__(self, item):
 208        """
 209        Retrieve a disulfide from the list. Internal only.
 210
 211        :param item: Index or slice
 212        :return: Sublist
 213        """
 214        if isinstance(item, slice):
 215            indices = range(*item.indices(len(self.data)))
 216            ind_list = list(indices)
 217            first_ind = ind_list[0]
 218            last_ind = ind_list[-1]
 219            name = (
 220                self.data[first_ind].pdb_id
 221                + f"_slice[{first_ind}:{last_ind+1}]_{self.data[last_ind].pdb_id}"
 222            )
 223            sublist = [self.data[i] for i in indices]
 224            return DisulfideList(sublist, name)
 225        return UserList.__getitem__(self, item)
 226
 227    def __setitem__(self, index, item):
 228        self.data[index] = self.validate_ss(item)
 229
 230    # Rendering engine calculates and instantiates all bond
 231    # cylinders and atomic sphere meshes. Called by all high level routines
 232
 233    def _render(self, pl, style, res=100) -> pv.Plotter:
 234        """
 235        Display a window showing the list of disulfides in the given style.
 236        :param style: one of 'cpk', 'bs', 'sb', 'plain', 'cov', 'pd'
 237        :return: Window in the relevant style
 238        """
 239        ssList = self.data
 240        tot_ss = len(ssList)  # number off ssbonds
 241        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 242        res = 100
 243
 244        if tot_ss > 30:
 245            res = 60
 246        if tot_ss > 60:
 247            res = 30
 248        if tot_ss > 90:
 249            res = 12
 250
 251        total_plots = rows * cols
 252        for idx in range(min(tot_ss, total_plots)):
 253            if not self.quiet:
 254                if idx % 5 == 0:
 255                    _logger.info("Rendering %d of %d bonds.", idx + 1, tot_ss)
 256
 257            r = idx // cols
 258            c = idx % cols
 259            pl.subplot(r, c)
 260
 261            ss = ssList[idx]
 262            src = ss.pdb_id
 263            enrg = ss.energy
 264            title = f"{src} {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: E: {enrg:.2f}, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}°"
 265            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
 266            ss._render(
 267                pl,
 268                style=style,
 269                res=res,
 270            )
 271
 272        return pl
 273
 274    @property
 275    def average_ca_distance(self):
 276        """
 277        Return the Average energy (kcal/mol) for the Disulfides in the list.
 278
 279        :return: Average energy (kcal/mol) between all atoms in the list
 280        """
 281        sslist = self.data
 282        tot = len(sslist)
 283        if tot == 0:
 284            return 0.0
 285
 286        total_dist = sum(ss.ca_distance for ss in sslist)
 287        return total_dist / tot
 288
 289    @property
 290    def average_distance(self):
 291        """
 292        Return the Average distance (Å) between the atoms in the list.
 293
 294        :return: Average distance (Å) between all atoms in the list
 295
 296        """
 297        sslist = self.data
 298        cnt = 1
 299
 300        total = 0.0
 301        for ss1 in sslist:
 302            for ss2 in sslist:
 303                if ss2 == ss1:
 304                    continue
 305                total += ss1.Distance_RMS(ss2)
 306                cnt += 1
 307
 308        return total / cnt
 309
 310    @property
 311    def average_energy(self):
 312        """
 313        Return the Average energy (kcal/mol) for the Disulfides in the list.
 314
 315        :return: Average energy (kcal/mol) between all atoms in the list
 316        """
 317        sslist = self.data
 318        tot = len(sslist)
 319        if tot == 0:
 320            return 0.0
 321
 322        total_energy = sum(ss.energy for ss in sslist)
 323        return total_energy / tot
 324
 325    @property
 326    def average_conformation(self):
 327        """
 328        Return the average conformation for the disulfides in the list.
 329
 330        :return: Average conformation: [x1, x2, x3, x4, x5]
 331        """
 332        sslist = self.data
 333        res = np.mean([ss.torsion_array for ss in sslist], axis=0)
 334        return res
 335
 336    def append(self, item):
 337        """
 338        Append the list with item
 339
 340        :param item: Disulfide to add
 341        :type item: Disulfide
 342        """
 343        self.data.append(self.validate_ss(item))
 344
 345    @property
 346    def average_resolution(self) -> float:
 347        """
 348        Compute and return the average structure resolution for the given list.
 349
 350        :return: Average resolution (A)
 351        """
 352        resolutions = [ss.resolution for ss in self.data if ss.resolution != -1.0]
 353        return sum(resolutions) / len(resolutions) if resolutions else -1.0
 354
 355    @property
 356    def resolution(self) -> float:
 357        """
 358        Compute and return the average structure resolution for the given list.
 359
 360        :return: Average resolution (A)
 361        """
 362        return self._res
 363
 364    @resolution.setter
 365    def resolution(self, value: float):
 366        """
 367        Set the average structure resolution for the given list.
 368
 369        :param value: The new resolution value to set.
 370        :type value: float
 371        """
 372        if not isinstance(value, float):
 373            raise TypeError("Resolution must be a float.")
 374        self._res = value
 375
 376    @property
 377    def average_torsion_distance(self):
 378        """
 379        Return the average distance in torsion space (degrees), between all pairs in the
 380        DisulfideList
 381
 382        :return: Torsion Distance (degrees)
 383        """
 384        sslist = self.data
 385        total = 0
 386        cnt = 0
 387
 388        for ss1, ss2 in combinations(sslist, 2):
 389            total += ss1.torsion_distance(ss2)
 390            cnt += 1
 391
 392        return float(total / cnt) if cnt > 0 else 0
 393
 394    def build_distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 395        """
 396        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList Cα-Cα and Sg-Sg distances, energy.
 397        This can take several minutes for the entire database.
 398
 399        :return: DataFrame containing Ca distances
 400        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
 401        """
 402        # create a list to collect rows as dictionaries
 403        rows = []
 404        i = 0
 405        sslist = self.data
 406        total_length = len(sslist)
 407        update_interval = max(1, total_length // 20)  # 5% of the list length
 408
 409        if self.quiet:
 410            pbar = sslist
 411        else:
 412            pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=PBAR_COLS, leave=False)
 413
 414        for ss in pbar:
 415            new_row = {
 416                "source": ss.pdb_id,
 417                "ss_id": ss.name,
 418                "proximal": ss.proximal,
 419                "distal": ss.distal,
 420                "energy": ss.energy,
 421                "ca_distance": ss.ca_distance,
 422                "cb_distance": ss.cb_distance,
 423                "sg_distance": ss.sg_distance,
 424            }
 425            rows.append(new_row)
 426            i += 1
 427
 428            if not self.quiet:
 429                if i % update_interval == 0 or i == total_length - 1:
 430                    pbar.update(update_interval)
 431
 432        # create the dataframe from the list of dictionaries
 433        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=Distance_DF_Cols)
 434
 435        return SS_df
 436
 437    # here we build a dataframe containing the torsional parameters
 438
 439    def build_torsion_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 440        """
 441        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList torsional parameters,
 442        Cα-Cα and Sg-Sg distances, energy, and phi-psi angles. This can take several minutes for the
 443        entire database.
 444
 445        :return: pd.DataFrame containing the torsions
 446        """
 447        # create a list to collect rows as dictionaries
 448        rows = []
 449        i = 0
 450        total_length = len(self.data)
 451        update_interval = max(1, total_length // 20)  # 5% of the list length
 452
 453        sslist = self.data
 454        if self.quiet:
 455            pbar = sslist
 456        else:
 457            pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=PBAR_COLS, leave=False)
 458
 459        for ss in pbar:
 460            new_row = {
 461                "source": ss.pdb_id,
 462                "ss_id": ss.name,
 463                "proximal": ss.proximal,
 464                "distal": ss.distal,
 465                "chi1": ss.chi1,
 466                "chi2": ss.chi2,
 467                "chi3": ss.chi3,
 468                "chi4": ss.chi4,
 469                "chi5": ss.chi5,
 470                "energy": ss.energy,
 471                "ca_distance": ss.ca_distance,
 472                "cb_distance": ss.cb_distance,
 473                "sg_distance": ss.sg_distance,
 474                "psi_prox": ss.psiprox,
 475                "phi_prox": ss.phiprox,
 476                "phi_dist": ss.phidist,
 477                "psi_dist": ss.psidist,
 478                "torsion_length": ss.torsion_length,
 479                "rho": ss.rho,
 480            }
 481            rows.append(new_row)
 482            i += 1
 483
 484            if not self.quiet:
 485                if i % update_interval == 0 or i == total_length - 1:
 486                    pbar.update(update_interval)
 487
 488        if not self.quiet:
 489            pbar.close()
 490
 491        # create the dataframe from the list of dictionaries
 492        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=Torsion_DF_Cols)
 493
 494        return SS_df
 495
 496    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
 497        """
 498        Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier.
 499
 500        :param chain: chain identifier, 'A', 'B, etc
 501        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides within that chain.
 502        """
 503
 504        reslist = DisulfideList([], chain)
 505        sslist = self.data
 506
 507        for ss in sslist:
 508            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
 509            dchain = ss.distal_chain
 510            if pchain == dchain:
 511                if pchain == chain:
 512                    reslist.append(ss)
 513            else:
 514                print(f"Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:")
 515        return reslist
 516
 517    @property
 518    def center_of_mass(self):
 519        """
 520        Calculate the center of mass for the Disulfide list
 521        """
 522        sslist = self.data
 523        tot = len(sslist)
 524        if tot == 0:
 525            return 0.0
 526
 527        total_cofmass = sum(ss.cofmass for ss in sslist)
 528        return total_cofmass / tot
 529
 530    def describe(self):
 531        """
 532        Prints out relevant attributes of the given disulfideList.
 533
 534        :param disulfideList: A list of disulfide objects.
 535        :param list_name: The name of the list.
 536        """
 537        name = self.pdb_id
 538        avg_distance = self.average_ca_distance
 539        avg_energy = self.average_energy
 540        avg_resolution = self.average_resolution
 541        list_length = len(self.data)
 542
 543        if list_length == 0:
 544            avg_bondangle = 0
 545            avg_bondlength = 0
 546        else:
 547            total_bondangle = 0
 548            total_bondlength = 0
 549
 550            for ss in self.data:
 551                total_bondangle += ss.bond_angle_ideality
 552                total_bondlength += ss.bond_length_ideality
 553
 554            avg_bondangle = total_bondangle / list_length
 555            avg_bondlength = total_bondlength / list_length
 556
 557        print(f"DisulfideList: {name}")
 558        print(f"Length: {list_length}")
 559        print(f"Average energy: {avg_energy:.2f} kcal/mol")
 560        print(f"Average CA distance: {avg_distance:.2f} Å")
 561        print(f"Average Resolution: {avg_resolution:.2f} Å")
 562        print(f"Bond angle deviation: {avg_bondangle:.2f}°")
 563        print(f"Bond length deviation: {avg_bondlength:.2f} Å")
 564
 565    def display(self, style="sb", light="Auto", panelsize=512):
 566        """
 567        Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.
 568
 569        :param single: Display the bond in a single panel in the specific style.
 570        :param style:  Rendering style: One of:\n
 571            - 'sb' - split bonds
 572            - 'bs' - ball and stick
 573            - 'cpk' - CPK style
 574            - 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
 575            - 'plain' - boring single color
 576        :light: If True, light background, if False, dark
 577        """
 578        # from proteusPy.utility import get_theme
 579
 580        pid = self.pdb_id
 581        ssbonds = self.data
 582        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number off ssbonds
 583        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 584        winsize = (panelsize * cols, panelsize * rows)
 585
 586        avg_enrg = self.average_energy
 587        avg_dist = self.average_distance
 588        resolution = self.average_resolution
 589
 590        if light == "light":
 591            pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 592        elif light == "dark":
 593            pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 594        else:
 595            _theme = get_theme()
 596            if _theme == "light":
 597                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 598            elif _theme == "dark":
 599                pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 600                _logger.info("Dark mode detected.")
 601            else:
 602                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 603
 604        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), Avg E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Avg Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
 605
 606        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(rows, cols))
 607        pl = self._render(pl, style)
 608        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 609        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
 610        pl.link_views()
 611        pl.reset_camera()
 612        pl.show()
 613
 614    def display_torsion_statistics(
 615        self,
 616        display=True,
 617        save=False,
 618        fname="ss_torsions.png",
 619        theme="auto",
 620    ):
 621        """
 622        Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.
 623
 624        :param display: Whether to display the plot in the notebook. Default is True.
 625        :type display: bool
 626        :param save: Whether to save the plot as an image file. Default is False.
 627        :type save: bool
 628        :param fname: The name of the image file to save. Default is 'ss_torsions.png'.
 629        :type fname: str
 630        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot. Default is 'Auto'. Options are 'Auto', 'light', and 'dark'.
 631        :type theme: str
 632        :return: none
 633        """
 634
 635        if self.length == 0:
 636            _logger.warning("Empty DisulfideList. Nothing to display.")
 637            return
 638
 639        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 640        title = f"{self.id}: {self.length} members"
 641
 642        tor_vals, dist_vals = self.calculate_torsion_statistics()
 643
 644        tor_mean_vals = tor_vals.loc["mean"]
 645        tor_std_vals = tor_vals.loc["std"]
 646
 647        dist_mean_vals = dist_vals.loc["mean"]
 648        dist_std_vals = dist_vals.loc["std"]
 649
 650        fig = make_subplots(
 651            rows=2, cols=2, vertical_spacing=0.125, column_widths=[1, 1]
 652        )
 653
 654        fig.update_layout(
 655            title={
 656                "text": title,
 657                "xanchor": "center",
 658                # 'y':.9,
 659                "x": 0.5,
 660                "yanchor": "top",
 661            },
 662            width=1024,
 663            height=1024,
 664        )
 665
 666        fig.add_trace(
 667            go.Bar(
 668                x=["X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "X5"],
 669                y=tor_mean_vals[:5],
 670                name="Torsion Angle (°) ",
 671                error_y=dict(type="data", array=tor_std_vals, visible=True),
 672            ),
 673            row=1,
 674            col=1,
 675        )
 676
 677        fig.add_trace(
 678            go.Bar(
 679                x=["rho"],
 680                y=[dist_mean_vals[4]],
 681                name="ρ (°)",
 682                error_y=dict(type="data", array=[dist_std_vals[4]], visible=True),
 683            ),
 684            row=1,
 685            col=1,
 686        )
 687
 688        # Update the layout of the subplot
 689        # Cα N, Cα, Cβ, C', Sγ Å °
 690
 691        fig.update_yaxes(
 692            title_text="Dihedral Angle (°)", range=[-200, 200], row=1, col=1
 693        )
 694        fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, 320], row=2, col=2)
 695
 696        # Add another subplot for the mean values of energy
 697        fig.add_trace(
 698            go.Bar(
 699                x=["Strain Energy (kcal/mol)"],
 700                y=[dist_mean_vals[3]],
 701                name="Energy (kcal/mol)",
 702                error_y=dict(
 703                    type="data",
 704                    array=[dist_std_vals[3].tolist()],
 705                    width=0.25,
 706                    visible=True,
 707                ),
 708            ),
 709            row=1,
 710            col=2,
 711        )
 712        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=1, col=2)
 713
 714        # Update the layout of the subplot
 715        # fig.update_xaxes(title_text="Energy", row=1, col=2)
 716        fig.update_yaxes(
 717            title_text="kcal/mol", range=[0, 20], row=1, col=2
 718        )  # max possible DSE
 719
 720        # Add another subplot for the mean values of ca_distance
 721        fig.add_trace(
 722            go.Bar(
 723                x=["Cα Distance (Å)", "Cβ Distance (Å)", "Sγ Distance (Å)"],
 724                y=[dist_mean_vals[0], dist_mean_vals[1], dist_mean_vals[2]],
 725                name="Distances (Å)",
 726                error_y=dict(
 727                    type="data",
 728                    array=[
 729                        dist_std_vals[0].tolist(),
 730                        dist_std_vals[1].tolist(),
 731                        dist_std_vals[2].tolist(),
 732                    ],
 733                    width=0.25,
 734                    visible=True,
 735                ),
 736            ),
 737            row=2,
 738            col=1,
 739        )
 740        # Update the layout of the subplot
 741        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Distance (A)", range=[0, 10], row=2, col=1)  #
 742        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=1)
 743
 744        # Add a scatter subplot for torsion length column
 745        fig.add_trace(
 746            go.Bar(
 747                x=["Torsion Length (Å)"],
 748                y=[tor_mean_vals[5]],
 749                name="Torsion Length, (Å)",
 750                error_y=dict(
 751                    type="data", array=[tor_std_vals[5]], width=0.25, visible=True
 752                ),
 753            ),
 754            row=2,
 755            col=2,
 756        )
 757        # Update the layout of the subplot
 758        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Torsion Length", range=[0, 350], row=2, col=2)
 759        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=2)
 760
 761        # Update the error bars
 762        fig.update_traces(
 763            error_y_thickness=2,
 764            error_y_color="gray",
 765            texttemplate="%{y:.2f} ± %{error_y.array:.2f}",
 766            textposition="outside",
 767        )  # , row=1, col=1)
 768
 769        if display:
 770            fig.show()
 771
 772        if save:
 773            fig.write_image(Path(fname))
 774
 775        return

 777    @property
 778    def distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 779        """
 780        Build and return the distance dataframe for the input list.
 781        This can take considerable time for the entire list.
 782
 783        :return: Dataframe containing the Cα-Cα distances for the given list.
 784
 785        Example:
 786        >>> from proteusPy import Disulfide, Load_PDB_SS, DisulfideList
 787        >>> PDB_SS = Load_PDB_SS()

 792    def display_overlay(
 793        self,
 794        screenshot=False,
 795        movie=False,
 796        verbose=False,
 797        fname="ss_overlay.png",
 798        light="Auto",
 799    ):
 800        """
 801        Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
 802        a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides
 803        at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.
 804
 805        :param screenshot: Save a screenshot, defaults to False
 806        :param movie: Save a movie, defaults to False
 807        :param verbose: Verbosity, defaults to True
 808        :param fname: Filename to save for the movie or screenshot, defaults to 'ss_overlay.png'
 809        :param light: Background color, defaults to True for White. False for Dark.
 810        """
 811
 812        # from proteusPy.utility import get_theme
 813
 814        pid = self.pdb_id
 815
 816        ssbonds = self.data
 817        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number off ssbonds
 818        avg_enrg = self.average_energy
 819        avg_dist = self.average_distance
 820        resolution = self.average_resolution
 821
 822        res = 64
 823
 824        if tot_ss > 30:
 825            res = 48
 826        if tot_ss > 60:
 827            res = 16
 828        if tot_ss > 90:
 829            res = 8
 830
 831        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), Avg E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Avg Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
 832
 833        if light == "light":
 834            pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 835        elif light == "dark":
 836            pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 837        else:
 838            _theme = get_theme()
 839            if _theme == "light":
 840                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 841            elif _theme == "dark":
 842                pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 843                _logger.info("Dark mode detected.")
 844            else:
 845                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 846
 847        if movie:
 848            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=True)
 849        else:
 850            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
 851
 852        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
 853        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 854        # pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
 855        pl.add_axes()
 856
 857        mycol = np.zeros(shape=(tot_ss, 3))
 858        mycol = get_jet_colormap(tot_ss)
 859
 860        # scale the overlay bond radii down so that we can see the individual elements better
 861        # maximum 90% reduction
 862
 863        brad = BOND_RADIUS if tot_ss < 10 else BOND_RADIUS * 0.75
 864        brad = brad if tot_ss < 25 else brad * 0.8
 865        brad = brad if tot_ss < 50 else brad * 0.8
 866        brad = brad if tot_ss < 100 else brad * 0.6
 867
 868        # print(f'Brad: {brad}')
 869        if verbose:
 870            pbar = tqdm(range(tot_ss), ncols=PBAR_COLS)
 871        else:
 872            pbar = range(tot_ss)
 873
 874        for i, ss in zip(pbar, ssbonds):
 875            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
 876            ss._render(
 877                pl,
 878                style="plain",
 879                bondcolor=color,
 880                translate=False,
 881                bond_radius=brad,
 882                res=res,
 883            )
 884
 885        pl.reset_camera()
 886
 887        if screenshot:
 888            pl.show(auto_close=False)  # allows for manipulation
 889            # Take the screenshot after ensuring the plotter is still active
 890            try:
 891                pl.screenshot(fname)
 892                if verbose:
 893                    print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved image to: {fname}")
 894            except RuntimeError as e:
 895                _logger.error("Error saving screenshot: %s", e)
 896
 897        elif movie:
 898            if verbose:
 899                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 900
 901            pl.open_movie(fname)
 902            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
 903            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
 904            pl.close()
 905
 906            if verbose:
 907                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 908        else:
 909            pl.show()
 910
 911        return

 913    def extend(self, other):
 914        """
 915        Extend the Disulfide list with other.
 916
 917        :param other: extension
 918        :type item: DisulfideList
 919        """
 920
 921        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
 922            self.data.extend(other)
 923        else:
 924            self.data.extend(self.validate_ss(item) for item in other)
 925
 926    def filter_by_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 2.0):
 927        """
 928        Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Ca distance and
 929        the minimum, which defaults to 2.0A.
 930
 931        :param distance: Distance in Å
 932        :param minimum: Distance in Å
 933        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
 934        """
 935
 936        reslist = []
 937        sslist = self.data
 938
 939        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
 940        if distance == -1.0:
 941            return sslist.copy()
 942
 943        reslist = [
 944            ss
 945            for ss in sslist
 946            if ss.ca_distance < distance and ss.ca_distance > minimum
 947        ]
 948
 949        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by distance < {distance:.2f}")
 950
 951    def filter_by_sg_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 1.0):
 952        """
 953        Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Sg distance and
 954        the minimum, which defaults to 1.0A.
 955
 956        :param distance: Distance in Å
 957        :param minimum: Distance in Å
 958        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
 959        """
 960
 961        reslist = []
 962        sslist = self.data
 963
 964        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
 965        if distance == -1.0:
 966            return sslist.copy()
 967
 968        reslist = [
 969            ss
 970            for ss in sslist
 971            if ss.sg_distance < distance and ss.sg_distance > minimum
 972        ]
 973
 974        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by Sγ distance < {distance:.2f}")
 975
 976    def filter_by_bond_ideality(self, angle: float = -1.0):
 977        """
 978        Return a DisulfideList filtered by bond angle ideality between the maxium angle
 979        and the minimum, which defaults to 0.0°.
 980
 981        :param angle: Angle in degrees
 982        :param minimum: Angle in degrees
 983        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given angle.
 984        """
 985
 986        reslist = []
 987        sslist = self.data
 988
 989        # if angle is -1.0, return the entire list
 990        if angle == -1.0:
 991            return sslist.copy()
 992
 993        reslist = [ss for ss in sslist if ss.bond_angle_ideality < angle]
 994
 995        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by bond angle < {angle:.2f}")

 997    def get_by_name(self, name):
 998        """
 999        Returns the Disulfide with the given name from the list.
1000        """
1001        for ss in self.data:
1002            if ss.name == name:
1003                return ss.copy()  # or ss.copy() !!!
1004        return None

1006    def get_chains(self):
1007        """
1008        Return the chain IDs for chains within the given Disulfide.
1009        :return: Chain IDs for given Disulfide
1010        """
1011
1012        res_dict = {"xxx"}
1013        sslist = self.data
1014
1015        for ss in sslist:
1016            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
1017            dchain = ss.distal_chain
1018            res_dict.update(pchain)
1019            res_dict.update(dchain)
1020
1021        res_dict.remove("xxx")
1022
1023        return res_dict

1025    def get_torsion_array(self):
1026        """
1027        Return a 2D NumPy array representing the dihedral angles in the given disulfide list.
1028
1029        :return: A 2D NumPy array of shape (n, 5), where n is the number of disulfide bonds in the list. Each row
1030                of the array represents the dihedral angles of a disulfide bond, in the following order:
1031                [X1, X, X3, X4, X5], where i is the index of the disulfide bond in the list.
1032        """
1033        return np.array([ss.torsion_array for ss in self.data])

1035    def has_chain(self, chain) -> bool:
1036        """
1037        Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide, False otherwise.
1038        :return: Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide, False otherwise.
1039        """
1040
1041        chns = {"xxx"}
1042        chns = self.get_chains()
1043        if chain in chns:
1044            return True
1045        else:
1046            return False

1092    def translate(self, translation_vector) -> None:
1093        """
1094        Translate the DisulfideList by the given translation vector.
1095        Note: The translation is a vector SUBTRACTION, not addition.
1096        This is used primarily to move a list to its geometric center of mass
1097        and is a destructive operation, in the sense that it updates the list in place.
1098
1099        :param translation_vector: The translation vector to apply.
1100        :type translation_vector: Vector3D
1101        """
1102        for ss in self.data:
1103            ss.translate(translation_vector)

1105    def insert(self, index, item):
1106        """
1107        Insert a Disulfide into the list at the specified index
1108
1109        :param index: insertion point
1110        :type index: int
1111        :param item: Disulfide to insert
1112        :type item: Disulfide
1113        """
1114        self.data.insert(index, self.validate_ss(item))

1116    @property

1118        """Return the length of the list"""

1121    @property
1122    def min(self) -> Disulfide:
1123        """
1124        Return Disulfide from the list with the minimum energy
1125
1126        :return: Disulfide with the minimum energy.
1127        """
1128        sslist = sorted(self.data)
1129        return sslist[0]
1130
1131    @property
1132    def max(self) -> Disulfide:
1133        """
1134        Return Disulfide from the list with the maximum energy
1135
1136        :return: Disulfide with the maximum energy. This assumes that
1137        the comparison is based on the energy attribute.
1138        """
1139        sslist = sorted(self.data)
1140        return sslist[-1]
1141
1142    def minmax_distance(self):
1143        """
1144        Return the Disulfides with the minimum and
1145        maximum Cα distances in the list.
1146
1147        :return: SSmin, SSmax
1148        """
1149        sslist = self.data
1150
1151        if not sslist:
1152            return None, None
1153
1154        ssmin = min(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
1155        ssmax = max(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
1156
1157        return ssmin, ssmax
1158
1159    @property
1160    def minmax_energy(self):
1161        """
1162        Return the Disulfides with the minimum and maximum energies
1163        from the DisulfideList.
1164
1165        :return: Disulfides with minimum and maximum energies
1166        """
1167        sslist = self.data
1168
1169        if not sslist:
1170            return None, None
1171
1172        sslist = sorted(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.energy)
1173        return sslist[0], sslist[-1]
1174
1175    def nearest_neighbors(self, cutoff: float, *args):
1176        """
1177        Return all Disulfides within the given angle cutoff of the input Disulfide.
1178
1179        :param cutoff: Distance cutoff, degrees
1180        :param args: Either 5 individual angles (chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5) or a list of 5 angles
1181        :return: DisulfideList of neighbors within the cutoff
1182        """
1183        if len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], list) and len(args[0]) == 5:
1184            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args[0]
1185        elif len(args) == 5:
1186            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args
1187        else:
1188            raise ValueError(
1189                "You must provide either 5 individual angles or a list of 5 angles."
1190            )
1191
1192        sslist = self.data
1193        modelss = proteusPy.Disulfide("model", torsions=[chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5])
1194        res = modelss.torsion_neighbors(sslist, cutoff)
1195
1196        resname = f"Neighbors within {cutoff:.2f}° of [{', '.join(f'{angle:.2f}' for angle in modelss.dihedrals)}]"
1197        res.pdb_id = resname
1198
1199        return res
1200
1201    def nearest_neighbors_ss(self, ss, cutoff: float):
1202        """
1203        Return the list of Disulfides within the torsional cutoff
1204        of the input Disulfide.
1205
1206        :param ss: Disulfide to compare to
1207        :param cutoff: Distance cutoff, degrees
1208        :return: DisulfideList of neighbors
1209        """
1210
1211        sslist = self.data
1212        res = ss.torsion_neighbors(sslist, cutoff)
1213
1214        resname = f"{ss.name} neighbors within {cutoff}°"
1215        res.pdb_id = resname
1216
1217        return res

1245    def validate_ss(self, value):
1246        """Return the Disulfide object if it is a Disulfide, otherwise raise an error"""
1247        from proteusPy.Disulfide import Disulfide
1248
1249        if value is None:
1250            raise ValueError("The value cannot be None.")
1251
1252        if not isinstance(value, Disulfide):
1253            raise TypeError("The value must be an instance of Disulfide.")
1254        return value

1256    def create_deviation_dataframe(self, verbose=False):
1257        """
1258        Create a DataFrame with columns PDB_ID, SS_Name, Angle_Deviation, Distance_Deviation,
1259        Ca Distance from a list of disulfides.
1260
1261        :param verbose: Whether to display a progress bar.
1262        :type verbose: bool
1263        :return: DataFrame containing the disulfide information.
1264        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
1265        """
1266        disulfide_list = self.data
1267        data = {
1268            "PDB_ID": [],
1269            "Resolution": [],
1270            "SS_Name": [],
1271            "Angle_Deviation": [],
1272            "Bondlength_Deviation": [],
1273            "Ca_Distance": [],
1274            "Sg_Distance": [],
1275        }
1276
1277        if verbose:
1278            pbar = tqdm(disulfide_list, desc="Processing...", leave=False)
1279        else:
1280            pbar = disulfide_list
1281
1282        for ss in pbar:
1283            data["PDB_ID"].append(ss.pdb_id)
1284            data["Resolution"].append(ss.resolution)
1285            data["SS_Name"].append(ss.name)
1286            data["Angle_Deviation"].append(ss.bond_angle_ideality)
1287            data["Bondlength_Deviation"].append(ss.bond_length_ideality)
1288            data["Ca_Distance"].append(ss.ca_distance)
1289            data["Sg_Distance"].append(ss.sg_distance)
1290
1291        df = pd.DataFrame(data)
1292        return df
1293
1294    def extract_distances(self, distance_type="sg", flip=False, cutoff=-1):
1295        """
1296        Extract and filter the distance values from the disulfide list based on the specified type and comparison.
1297
1298        :param disulfide_list: List of disulfide objects.
1299        :param distance_type: Type of distance to extract ('sg' or 'ca').
1300        :param flip: If true, return distances greater than the cutoff value.
1301        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for filtering distances.
1302        :return: List of filtered distance values.
1303        """
1304        disulfide_list = self.data
1305        distances = filtered_distances = []
1306
1307        match distance_type:
1308            case "sg":
1309                distances = [ds.sg_distance for ds in disulfide_list]
1310            case "ca":
1311                distances = [ds.ca_distance for ds in disulfide_list]
1312            case _:
1313                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
1314
1315        if cutoff == -1.0:
1316            return distances
1317
1318        if flip:
1319            filtered_distances = [d for d in distances if d > cutoff]
1320        else:
1321            filtered_distances = [d for d in distances if d <= cutoff]
1322
1323        return filtered_distances
1324
1325    def plot_distances(
1326        self, distance_type="sg", cutoff=-1, flip=False, theme="auto", log=True
1327    ):
1328        """
1329        Plot the distance values as a histogram using plotly express.
1330
1331        :param distances: List of distance values.
1332        :param distance_type: Type of distance to plot ('sg' or 'ca').
1333        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for the x-axis title.
1334        :param flip: Whether to flip the comparison in the x-axis title.
1335        :param theme: The plotly theme to use. Default is 'auto', which will use the current system theme.
1336        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis. Default is True.
1337        """
1338
1339        set_plotly_theme(theme)
1340        cmp_str = "less" if not flip else "greater"
1341
1342        distances = self.extract_distances(distance_type, cmp_str, cutoff)
1343        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
1344
1345        match distance_type:
1346            case "sg":
1347                column_name = "SG Distance"
1348                title = "Sγ Distance Distribution"
1349                if cutoff == -1.0:
1350                    xtitle = "Sγ-Sγ Distances, (no cutoff)"
1351                else:
1352                    xtitle = (
1353                        f"Sγ Distance < {cutoff} Å"
1354                        if not flip
1355                        else f"Sγ-Sγ Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
1356                    )
1357            case "ca":
1358                column_name = "Ca Distance"
1359                title = "Cα Distance Distribution"
1360                if cutoff == -1.0:
1361                    xtitle = "Cα-Cα Distances, (no cutoff)"
1362                else:
1363                    xtitle = (
1364                        f"Cα Distance < {cutoff} Å"
1365                        if not flip
1366                        else f"Cα-Cα Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
1367                    )
1368            case _:
1369                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
1370
1371        # Convert to a Pandas DataFrame with the appropriate column name
1372        df = pd.DataFrame(distances, columns=[column_name])
1373
1374        fig = px.histogram(
1375            df,
1376            x=column_name,  # Use the column name for the x-axis
1377            nbins=NBINS,
1378            title=title,
1379        )
1380        fig.update_layout(
1381            title={"text": "Distance Distribution", "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
1382            xaxis_title=xtitle,
1383            yaxis_title="Frequency",
1384            yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
1385            bargap=0.2,
1386        )
1387        fig.show()
1388

1440    def filter_deviation_df_by_cutoffs(
1441        self,
1442        length_cutoff=10.0,
1443        angle_cutoff=100.0,
1444        ca_cutoff=1000.0,
1445        sg_cutoff=10.0,
1446        minimum_distance=0.0,
1447    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
1448        """
1449        Filter the DataFrame based on bond length, angle, Ca and Sg distance cutoffs.
1450
1451        Note: The default values are set to high values to allow all structures to pass the filter.
1452
1453        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviations.
1454        :type df: pd.DataFrame
1455        :param length_cutoff: Cutoff value for Bond Length Deviation.
1456        :type distance_cutoff: float
1457        :param angle_cutoff: Cutoff value for angle deviation.
1458        :type angle_cutoff: float
1459        :param ca_cutoff: Cutoff value for Ca distance.
1460        :type ca_cutoff: float
1461        :param sg_cutoff: Cutoff value for Sg distance.
1462        :type sg_cutoff: float
1463        :return: Filtered DataFrame.
1464        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
1465        """
1466        df = self.create_deviation_dataframe()
1467
1468        filtered_df = df[
1469            (df["Bondlength_Deviation"] <= length_cutoff)
1470            & (df["Angle_Deviation"] <= angle_cutoff)
1471            & (df["Ca_Distance"] >= minimum_distance)
1472            & (df["Ca_Distance"] <= ca_cutoff)
1473            & (df["Sg_Distance"] >= minimum_distance)
1474            & (df["Sg_Distance"] <= sg_cutoff)
1475        ]
1476        return filtered_df
1477
1478    def bad_filter_deviation_df_by_cutoffs(
1479        self,
1480        length_cutoff=0.0,
1481        angle_cutoff=0.0,
1482        ca_cutoff=0.0,
1483        sg_cutoff=0.0,
1484        minimum_distance=0.0,
1485    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
1486        """
1487        Return the DataFrame objects that are GREATER than the cutoff based on distance,
1488        angle, Ca and Sg distance cutoffs. Used to get the bad structures.
1489
1490        Note: The default values are set to low values to allow all structures to pass the filter.
1491
1492        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviations.
1493        :type df: pd.DataFrame
1494        :param length_cutoff: Cutoff value for Bond Length Deviation.
1495        :type length_cutoff: float
1496        :param angle_cutoff: Cutoff value for angle deviation.
1497        :type angle_cutoff: float
1498        :param ca_cutoff: Cutoff value for Ca distance.
1499        :type ca_cutoff: float
1500        :return: Filtered DataFrame.
1501        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
1502        """
1503        df = self.create_deviation_dataframe()
1504
1505        filtered_df = df[
1506            (df["Bondlength_Deviation"] > length_cutoff)
1507            & (df["Angle_Deviation"] > angle_cutoff)
1508            & (df["Ca_Distance"] > ca_cutoff)
1509            & (df["Ca_Distance"] < minimum_distance)
1510            & (df["Sg_Distance"] > sg_cutoff)
1511            & (df["Sg_Distance"] < minimum_distance)
1512        ]
1513        return filtered_df
1514
1515    def calculate_torsion_statistics(self) -> tuple:
1516        """
1517        Calculate and return the torsion and distance statistics for the DisulfideList.
1518
1519        This method builds a DataFrame containing torsional parameters, Cα-Cα distance,
1520        energy, and phi-psi angles for the DisulfideList. It then calculates the mean
1521        and standard deviation for the torsional and distance parameters.
1522
1523        :return: A tuple containing two DataFrames:
1524                - tor_stats: DataFrame with mean and standard deviation for torsional parameters.
1525                - dist_stats: DataFrame with mean and standard deviation for distance parameters.
1526        :rtype: tuple (pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame)
1527        """
1528
1529        df = self.torsion_df
1530
1531        tor_cols = ["chi1", "chi2", "chi3", "chi4", "chi5", "torsion_length"]
1532        dist_cols = ["ca_distance", "cb_distance", "sg_distance", "energy", "rho"]
1533        tor_stats = {}
1534        dist_stats = {}
1535
1536        def circular_mean(series):
1537            """
1538            Calculate the circular mean of a series of angles.
1539
1540            This function converts the input series of angles from degrees to radians,
1541            computes the mean of the sine and cosine of these angles, and then converts
1542            the result back to degrees.
1543
1544            :param series: A sequence of angles in degrees.
1545            :type series: array-like
1546            :return: The circular mean of the input angles in degrees.
1547            :rtype: float
1548            """
1549            radians = np.deg2rad(series)
1550            sin_mean = np.sin(radians).mean()
1551            cos_mean = np.cos(radians).mean()
1552            return np.rad2deg(np.arctan2(sin_mean, cos_mean))
1553
1554        for col in tor_cols[:5]:
1555            tor_stats[col] = {"mean": circular_mean(df[col]), "std": df[col].std()}
1556
1557        tor_stats["torsion_length"] = {
1558            "mean": df["torsion_length"].mean(),
1559            "std": df["torsion_length"].std(),
1560        }
1561
1562        for col in dist_cols:
1563            dist_stats[col] = {"mean": df[col].mean(), "std": df[col].std()}
1564
1565        tor_stats = pd.DataFrame(tor_stats, columns=tor_cols)
1566        dist_stats = pd.DataFrame(dist_stats, columns=dist_cols)
1567
1568        return tor_stats, dist_stats
1569

1573def load_disulfides_from_id(
1574    pdb_id: str,
1575    pdb_dir=MODEL_DIR,
1576    verbose=False,
1577    quiet=True,
1578    dbg=False,
1579    cutoff=-1.0,
1580    sg_cutoff=-1.0,
1581) -> DisulfideList:
1582    """
1583    Loads the Disulfides by PDB ID and returns a DisulfideList of Disulfide objects.
1584    Assumes the file is downloaded in the pdb_dir path.
1585
1586    :param pdb_id: The name of the PDB entry.
1587    :param pdb_dir: Path to the PDB files, defaults to MODEL_DIR. This is: PDB_DIR/good and are
1588                    the pre-parsed PDB files that have been scanned by the DisulfideDownloader program.
1589    :param verbose: Print info while parsing.
1590    :param quiet: Suppress non-error logging output.
1591    :param dbg: Enable debug logging.
1592    :param cutoff: Distance cutoff for filtering disulfides.
1593    :param sg_cutoff: SG distance cutoff for filtering disulfides.
1594    :return: A DisulfideList of Disulfide objects initialized from the file.
1595
1596    Example:
1597
1598    PDB_DIR defaults to os.getenv('PDB').
1599    To load the Disulfides from the PDB ID 5rsa we'd use the following:
1600
1601    >>> from proteusPy.DisulfideList import DisulfideList, load_disulfides_from_id
1602    >>> from proteusPy.ProteusGlobals import DATA_DIR
1603    >>> SSlist = DisulfideList([],'5rsa')
1604    >>> SSlist = load_disulfides_from_id('5rsa', pdb_dir=DATA_DIR, verbose=False)
1605    >>> SSlist
1606    [<Disulfide 5rsa_26A_84A, Source: 5rsa, Resolution: 2.0 Å>, <Disulfide 5rsa_40A_95A, Source: 5rsa, Resolution: 2.0 Å>, <Disulfide 5rsa_58A_110A, Source: 5rsa, Resolution: 2.0 Å>, <Disulfide 5rsa_65A_72A, Source: 5rsa, Resolution: 2.0 Å>]
1607    """
1608
1609    from proteusPy.Disulfide import Initialize_Disulfide_From_Coords
1610    from proteusPy.ssparser import extract_ssbonds_and_atoms
1611
1612    i = 1
1613    proximal = distal = -1
1614    chain1_id = chain2_id = ""
1615    ssbond_atom_list = {}
1616    num_ssbonds = 0
1617    delta = 0
1618    errors = 0
1619    resolution = -1.0
1620
1621    structure_fname = os.path.join(pdb_dir, f"pdb{pdb_id}.ent")
1622
1623    if verbose:
1624        mess = f"Parsing structure: {pdb_id}:"
1625        _logger.info(mess)
1626
1627    SSList = DisulfideList([], pdb_id, resolution)
1628
1629    ssbond_atom_list, num_ssbonds, errors = extract_ssbonds_and_atoms(
1630        structure_fname, verbose=verbose
1631    )
1632
1633    if num_ssbonds == 0:
1634        mess = f"->{pdb_id} has no SSBonds."
1635        if verbose:
1636            print(mess)
1637        _logger.warning(mess)
1638        return None
1639
1640    if quiet:
1641        _logger.setLevel(logging.ERROR)
1642
1643    if verbose:
1644        mess = f"{pdb_id} has {num_ssbonds} SSBonds, found: {errors} errors"
1645        _logger.info(mess)
1646
1647    resolution = ssbond_atom_list["resolution"]
1648    for pair in ssbond_atom_list["pairs"]:
1649        proximal = pair["proximal"][1]
1650        chain1_id = pair["proximal"][0]
1651        distal = pair["distal"][1]
1652        chain2_id = pair["distal"][0]
1653        proximal_secondary = pair["prox_secondary"]
1654        distal_secondary = pair["dist_secondary"]
1655
1656        if dbg:
1657            mess = f"Proximal: {proximal} {chain1_id} Distal: {distal} {chain2_id}"
1658            _logger.debug(mess)
1659
1660        proximal_int = int(proximal)
1661        distal_int = int(distal)
1662
1663        if proximal == distal:
1664            if verbose:
1665                mess = (
1666                    f"SSBond record has (proximal == distal): "
1667                    f"{pdb_id} Prox: {proximal} {chain1_id} Dist: {distal} {chain2_id}."
1668                )
1669                _logger.error(mess)
1670
1671        if proximal == distal and chain1_id == chain2_id:
1672            mess = (
1673                f"SSBond record has self reference, skipping: "
1674                f"{pdb_id} <{proximal} {chain1_id}> <{distal} {chain2_id}>"
1675            )
1676
1677            _logger.error(mess)
1678            continue
1679
1680        if verbose:
1681            mess = (
1682                f"SSBond: {i}: {pdb_id}: {proximal} {chain1_id} - {distal} {chain2_id}"
1683            )
1684            _logger.info(mess)
1685
1686        new_ss = Initialize_Disulfide_From_Coords(
1687            ssbond_atom_list,
1688            pdb_id,
1689            chain1_id,
1690            chain2_id,
1691            proximal_int,
1692            distal_int,
1693            resolution,
1694            proximal_secondary,
1695            distal_secondary,
1696            verbose=verbose,
1697            quiet=quiet,
1698            dbg=dbg,
1699        )
1700
1701        if new_ss is not None:
1702            SSList.append(new_ss)
1703            if verbose:
1704                mess = f"Initialized Disulfide: {pdb_id} Prox: {proximal} {chain1_id} Dist: {distal} {chain2_id}."
1705                _logger.info(mess)
1706        else:
1707            mess = f"Cannot initialize Disulfide: {pdb_id} <{proximal} {chain1_id}> <{distal} {chain2_id}>"
1708            _logger.error(mess)
1709
1710        i += 1
1711
1712    # restore default logging level
1713    if quiet:
1714        _logger.setLevel(logging.WARNING)
1715
1716    num_ssbonds = len(SSList)
1717
1718    if cutoff > 0:
1719        SSList = SSList.filter_by_distance(cutoff)
1720        delta = num_ssbonds - len(SSList)
1721        if delta:
1722            _logger.error(
1723                "Filtered %d -> %d SSBonds by Ca distance, %s, delta is: %d",
1724                num_ssbonds,
1725                len(SSList),
1726                pdb_id,
1727                delta,
1728            )
1729        num_ssbonds = len(SSList)
1730
1731    if sg_cutoff > 0:
1732        SSList = SSList.filter_by_sg_distance(sg_cutoff)
1733        delta = num_ssbonds - len(SSList)
1734        if delta:
1735            _logger.error(
1736                "Filtered %d -> %d SSBonds by Sγ distance, %s, delta is: %d",
1737                num_ssbonds,
1738                len(SSList),
1739                pdb_id,
1740                delta,
1741            )
1742
1743    return copy.deepcopy(SSList)
1744
1745
1746def extract_disulfide(
1747    pdb_filename: str, verbose=False, quiet=True, pdbdir=PDB_DIR
1748) -> DisulfideList:
1749    """
1750    Read the PDB file represented by `pdb_filename` and return a `DisulfideList`
1751    containing the Disulfide bonds found.
1752
1753    :param pdb_filename:   The filename of the PDB file to read.
1754    :param verbose:        Display more messages (default: False).
1755    :param quiet:          Turn off DisulfideConstruction warnings (default: True).
1756    :param pdbdir:         Path to PDB files (default: PDB_DIR).
1757    :return:               A `DisulfideList` containing the Disulfide bonds found.
1758    :rtype:                DisulfideList
1759    """
1760
1761    def extract_id_from_filename(filename: str) -> str:
1762        """
1763        Extract the ID from a filename formatted as 'pdb{id}.ent'.
1764
1765        :param filename: The filename to extract the ID from.
1766        :type filename: str
1767        :return: The extracted ID.
1768        :rtype: str
1769        """
1770        basename = os.path.basename(filename)
1771        # Check if the filename follows the expected format
1772        if basename.startswith("pdb") and filename.endswith(".ent"):
1773            # Extract the ID part of the filename
1774            return filename[3:-4]
1775
1776        mess = f"Filename {filename} does not follow the expected format 'pdb{id}.ent'"
1777        raise ValueError(mess)
1778
1779    pdbid = extract_id_from_filename(pdb_filename)
1780
1781    # returns an empty list if none are found.
1782    _sslist = DisulfideList([], pdbid)
1783    _sslist = load_disulfides_from_id(
1784        pdbid, verbose=verbose, quiet=quiet, pdb_dir=pdbdir
1785    )
1786
1787    if len(_sslist) == 0 or _sslist is None:
1788        mess = f"Can't find SSBonds: {pdbid}"
1789        _logger.error(mess)
1790        return DisulfideList([], pdbid)
1791
1792    return _sslist
1793
