class DisulfideList(collections.UserList): 
 105class DisulfideList(UserList):
 106    """
 107    The class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects.
 108    Indexing and slicing are supported, as well as typical list operations like
 109    ``.insert()``, ``.append()`` and ``.extend().`` The DisulfideList object must be initialized
 110    with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name. Sorting is keyed by torsional energy.
 111
 112    The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the
 113    [display()](#DisulfideList.display) and [display_overlay()](#DisulfideList.display_overlay)methods.
 114    See below for examples.\n
 115
 116    Examples:
 117    >>> from proteusPy import Disulfide, DisulfideLoader, DisulfideList, Load_PDB_SS
 118
 119    Instantiate some variables. Note: the list is initialifzed with an iterable and a name (optional)
 120
 121    >>> SS = Disulfide('tmp')
 122
 123    The list is initialized with an iterable, a name and resolution. Name and resolution
 124    are optional.
 125    >>> SSlist = DisulfideList([],'ss', -1.0)
 126
 127    Load the database.
 128    >>> PDB_SS = Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True)
 129
 130    Get the first disulfide via indexing.
 131    >>> SS = PDB_SS[0]
 132
 133    # assert str(SS) == "<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>"
 134
 135    >>> SS4yys = PDB_SS['4yys']
 136
 137    # assert str(SS4yys) == "[<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>, <Disulfide 4yys_56A_98A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>, <Disulfide 4yys_156A_207A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>]"
 138
 139    Make some empty disulfides.
 140    >>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
 141    >>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')
 142
 143    Make a DisulfideList containing ss1, named 'tmp'
 144    >>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1], 'tmp')
 145    >>> sslist.append(ss2)
 146
 147    Extract the first disulfide
 148    >>> ss1 = PDB_SS[0]
 149
 150    # assert str(ss1.pprint_all()) == "<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å\n Proximal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 22, ' '))> Distal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 65, ' '))>\nProximal Coordinates:\n   N: <Vector -2.36, -20.48, 5.21>\n   Cα: <Vector -2.10, -19.89, 3.90>\n   C: <Vector -1.12, -18.78, 4.12>\n   O: <Vector -1.30, -17.96, 5.03>\n   Cβ: <Vector -3.38, -19.31, 3.32>\n   Sγ: <Vector -3.24, -18.40, 1.76>\n   Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>\n   Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>\n Distal Coordinates:\n   N: <Vector -0.60, -18.71, -1.62>\n   Cα: <Vector -0.48, -19.10, -0.22>\n   C: <Vector 0.92, -19.52, 0.18>\n   O: <Vector 1.10, -20.09, 1.25>\n   Cβ: <Vector -1.48, -20.23, 0.08>\n   Sγ: <Vector -3.22, -19.69, 0.18>\n   Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>\n   Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>\n<BLANKLINE>\n Proximal Internal Coords:\n   N: <Vector -0.41, 1.40, -0.00>\n   Cα: <Vector 0.00, 0.00, 0.00>\n   C: <Vector 1.50, 0.00, 0.00>\n   O: <Vector 2.12, 0.71, -0.80>\n   Cβ: <Vector -0.50, -0.70, -1.25>\n   Sγ: <Vector 0.04, -2.41, -1.50>\n   Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>\n   Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>\nDistal Internal Coords:\n   N: <Vector 1.04, -5.63, 1.17>\n   Cα: <Vector 1.04, -4.18, 1.31>\n   C: <Vector 1.72, -3.68, 2.57>\n   O: <Vector 1.57, -2.51, 2.92>\n   Cβ: <Vector -0.41, -3.66, 1.24>\n   Sγ: <Vector -1.14, -3.69, -0.43>\n   Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>\n   Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>\n Χ1-Χ5: 174.63°, 82.52°, -83.32°, -62.52° -73.83°, 138.89°, 1.70 kcal/mol\n Cα Distance: 4.50 Å\n Torsion length: 231.53 deg>"
 151
 152    Get a list of disulfides via slicing
 153    >>> subset = DisulfideList(PDB_SS[0:10],'subset')
 154
 155    Display the subset disulfides overlaid onto the same coordinate frame,
 156    (proximal N, Ca, C').
 157
 158    The disulfides are colored individually to facilitate inspection.
 159
 160    >>> subset.display_overlay()
 161    """
 162
 163    def __init__(self, iterable, pid: str = "nil", res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False):
 164        """
 165        Initialize the DisulfideList.
 166
 167        :param iterable: An iterable of disulfide bonds.
 168        :type iterable: iterable
 169        :param pid: Name for the list, default is "nil".
 170        :type pid: str
 171        :param res: Resolution, default is -1.0. If -1, the average resolution is used.
 172        :type res: float
 173        :param quiet: If True, suppress output, default is True.
 174        :type quiet: bool
 175        :param fast: If True, enable fast mode, default is False.
 176        :type fast: bool
 177
 178        Example:
 179        >>> from proteusPy import DisulfideList, Disulfide
 180
 181        Initialize some empty disulfides.
 182        >>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
 183        >>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')
 184        >>> ss3 = Disulfide('ss3')
 185
 186        Make a list containing the disulfides.
 187        >>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1, ss2], 'sslist')
 188        >>> sslist
 189        [<Disulfide ss1, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss2, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>]
 190        >>> sslist.append(ss3)
 191        >>> sslist
 192        [<Disulfide ss1, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss2, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss3, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>]
 193        """
 194
 195        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
 196
 197        self.pdb_id = pid
 198        self.quiet = quiet
 199
 200        if not fast:
 201            if res == -1:
 202                self._res = self.average_resolution
 203            else:
 204                self._res = res
 205        else:
 206            self._res = res
 207
 208    def __getitem__(self, item):
 209        """
 210        Retrieve a disulfide from the list. Internal only.
 211
 212        :param item: Index or slice
 213        :return: Sublist
 214        """
 215        if isinstance(item, slice):
 216            indices = range(*item.indices(len(self.data)))
 217            ind_list = list(indices)
 218            first_ind = ind_list[0]
 219            last_ind = ind_list[-1]
 220            name = (
 221                self.data[first_ind].pdb_id
 222                + f"_slice[{first_ind}:{last_ind+1}]_{self.data[last_ind].pdb_id}"
 223            )
 224            sublist = [self.data[i] for i in indices]
 225            return DisulfideList(sublist, name)
 226        return UserList.__getitem__(self, item)
 227
 228    def __setitem__(self, index, item):
 229        self.data[index] = self.validate_ss(item)
 230
 231    # Rendering engine calculates and instantiates all bond
 232    # cylinders and atomic sphere meshes. Called by all high level routines
 233
 234    def _render(self, pl, style, res=100) -> pv.Plotter:
 235        """
 236        Display a window showing the list of disulfides in the given style.
 237        :param style: one of 'cpk', 'bs', 'sb', 'plain', 'cov', 'pd'
 238        :return: Window in the relevant style
 239        """
 240        ssList = self.data
 241        tot_ss = len(ssList)  # number off ssbonds
 242        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 243        res = 100
 244
 245        if tot_ss > 30:
 246            res = 60
 247        if tot_ss > 60:
 248            res = 30
 249        if tot_ss > 90:
 250            res = 12
 251
 252        total_plots = rows * cols
 253        for idx in range(min(tot_ss, total_plots)):
 254            if not self.quiet:
 255                if idx % 5 == 0:
 256                    _logger.info("Rendering %d of %d bonds.", idx + 1, tot_ss)
 257
 258            r = idx // cols
 259            c = idx % cols
 260            pl.subplot(r, c)
 261
 262            ss = ssList[idx]
 263            src = ss.pdb_id
 264            enrg = ss.energy
 265            title = f"{src} {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: E: {enrg:.2f}, Cα: {ss.ca_distance:.2f} Å, Tors: {ss.torsion_length:.2f}°"
 266            pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
 267            ss._render(
 268                pl,
 269                style=style,
 270                res=res,
 271            )
 272
 273        return pl
 274
 275    @property
 276    def average_ca_distance(self):
 277        """
 278        Return the Average energy (kcal/mol) for the Disulfides in the list.
 279
 280        :return: Average energy (kcal/mol) between all atoms in the list
 281        """
 282        sslist = self.data
 283        tot = len(sslist)
 284        if tot == 0:
 285            return 0.0
 286
 287        total_dist = sum(ss.ca_distance for ss in sslist)
 288        return total_dist / tot
 289
 290    @property
 291    def average_distance(self):
 292        """
 293        Return the Average distance (Å) between the atoms in the list.
 294
 295        :return: Average distance (Å) between all atoms in the list
 296
 297        """
 298        sslist = self.data
 299        cnt = 1
 300
 301        total = 0.0
 302        for ss1 in sslist:
 303            for ss2 in sslist:
 304                if ss2 == ss1:
 305                    continue
 306                total += ss1.Distance_RMS(ss2)
 307                cnt += 1
 308
 309        return total / cnt
 310
 311    @property
 312    def average_energy(self):
 313        """
 314        Return the Average energy (kcal/mol) for the Disulfides in the list.
 315
 316        :return: Average energy (kcal/mol) between all atoms in the list
 317        """
 318        sslist = self.data
 319        tot = len(sslist)
 320        if tot == 0:
 321            return 0.0
 322
 323        total_energy = sum(ss.energy for ss in sslist)
 324        return total_energy / tot
 325
 326    @property
 327    def average_conformation(self):
 328        """
 329        Return the average conformation for the disulfides in the list.
 330
 331        :return: Average conformation: [x1, x2, x3, x4, x5]
 332        """
 333        sslist = self.data
 334        res = np.mean([ss.torsion_array for ss in sslist], axis=0)
 335        return res
 336
 337    def append(self, item):
 338        """
 339        Append the list with item
 340
 341        :param item: Disulfide to add
 342        :type item: Disulfide
 343        """
 344        self.data.append(self.validate_ss(item))
 345
 346    @property
 347    def average_resolution(self) -> float:
 348        """
 349        Compute and return the average structure resolution for the given list.
 350
 351        :return: Average resolution (A)
 352        """
 353        resolutions = [ss.resolution for ss in self.data if ss.resolution != -1.0]
 354        return sum(resolutions) / len(resolutions) if resolutions else -1.0
 355
 356    @property
 357    def resolution(self) -> float:
 358        """
 359        Compute and return the average structure resolution for the given list.
 360
 361        :return: Average resolution (A)
 362        """
 363        return self._res
 364
 365    @resolution.setter
 366    def resolution(self, value: float):
 367        """
 368        Set the average structure resolution for the given list.
 369
 370        :param value: The new resolution value to set.
 371        :type value: float
 372        """
 373        if not isinstance(value, float):
 374            raise TypeError("Resolution must be a float.")
 375        self._res = value
 376
 377    @property
 378    def average_torsion_distance(self):
 379        """
 380        Return the average distance in torsion space (degrees), between all pairs in the
 381        DisulfideList
 382
 383        :return: Torsion Distance (degrees)
 384        """
 385        sslist = self.data
 386        total = 0
 387        cnt = 0
 388
 389        for ss1, ss2 in combinations(sslist, 2):
 390            total += ss1.torsion_distance(ss2)
 391            cnt += 1
 392
 393        return float(total / cnt) if cnt > 0 else 0
 394
 395    def build_distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 396        """
 397        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList Cα-Cα and Sg-Sg distances, energy.
 398        This can take several minutes for the entire database.
 399
 400        :return: DataFrame containing Ca distances
 401        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
 402        """
 403        # create a list to collect rows as dictionaries
 404        rows = []
 405        i = 0
 406        sslist = self.data
 407        total_length = len(sslist)
 408        update_interval = max(1, total_length // 20)  # 5% of the list length
 409
 410        if self.quiet:
 411            pbar = sslist
 412        else:
 413            pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=PBAR_COLS, leave=False)
 414
 415        for ss in pbar:
 416            new_row = {
 417                "source": ss.pdb_id,
 418                "ss_id": ss.name,
 419                "proximal": ss.proximal,
 420                "distal": ss.distal,
 421                "energy": ss.energy,
 422                "ca_distance": ss.ca_distance,
 423                "cb_distance": ss.cb_distance,
 424                "sg_distance": ss.sg_distance,
 425            }
 426            rows.append(new_row)
 427            i += 1
 428
 429            if not self.quiet:
 430                if i % update_interval == 0 or i == total_length - 1:
 431                    pbar.update(update_interval)
 432
 433        # create the dataframe from the list of dictionaries
 434        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=Distance_DF_Cols)
 435
 436        return SS_df
 437
 438    # here we build a dataframe containing the torsional parameters
 439
 440    def build_torsion_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 441        """
 442        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList torsional parameters,
 443        Cα-Cα and Sg-Sg distances, energy, and phi-psi angles. This can take several minutes for the
 444        entire database.
 445
 446        :return: pd.DataFrame containing the torsions
 447        """
 448        # create a list to collect rows as dictionaries
 449        rows = []
 450        i = 0
 451        total_length = len(self.data)
 452        update_interval = max(1, total_length // 20)  # 5% of the list length
 453
 454        sslist = self.data
 455        if self.quiet:
 456            pbar = sslist
 457        else:
 458            pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=PBAR_COLS, leave=False)
 459
 460        for ss in pbar:
 461            new_row = {
 462                "source": ss.pdb_id,
 463                "ss_id": ss.name,
 464                "proximal": ss.proximal,
 465                "distal": ss.distal,
 466                "chi1": ss.chi1,
 467                "chi2": ss.chi2,
 468                "chi3": ss.chi3,
 469                "chi4": ss.chi4,
 470                "chi5": ss.chi5,
 471                "energy": ss.energy,
 472                "ca_distance": ss.ca_distance,
 473                "cb_distance": ss.cb_distance,
 474                "sg_distance": ss.sg_distance,
 475                "psi_prox": ss.psiprox,
 476                "phi_prox": ss.phiprox,
 477                "phi_dist": ss.phidist,
 478                "psi_dist": ss.psidist,
 479                "torsion_length": ss.torsion_length,
 480                "rho": ss.rho,
 481            }
 482            rows.append(new_row)
 483            i += 1
 484
 485            if not self.quiet:
 486                if i % update_interval == 0 or i == total_length - 1:
 487                    pbar.update(update_interval)
 488
 489        if not self.quiet:
 490            pbar.close()
 491
 492        # create the dataframe from the list of dictionaries
 493        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=Torsion_DF_Cols)
 494
 495        return SS_df
 496
 497    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
 498        """
 499        Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier.
 500
 501        :param chain: chain identifier, 'A', 'B, etc
 502        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides within that chain.
 503        """
 504
 505        reslist = DisulfideList([], chain)
 506        sslist = self.data
 507
 508        for ss in sslist:
 509            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
 510            dchain = ss.distal_chain
 511            if pchain == dchain:
 512                if pchain == chain:
 513                    reslist.append(ss)
 514            else:
 515                print(f"Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:")
 516        return reslist
 517
 518    @property
 519    def center_of_mass(self):
 520        """
 521        Calculate the center of mass for the Disulfide list
 522        """
 523        sslist = self.data
 524        tot = len(sslist)
 525        if tot == 0:
 526            return 0.0
 527
 528        total_cofmass = sum(ss.cofmass for ss in sslist)
 529        return total_cofmass / tot
 530
 531    def describe(self):
 532        """
 533        Prints out relevant attributes of the given disulfideList.
 534
 535        :param disulfideList: A list of disulfide objects.
 536        :param list_name: The name of the list.
 537        """
 538        name = self.pdb_id
 539        avg_distance = self.average_ca_distance
 540        avg_energy = self.average_energy
 541        avg_resolution = self.average_resolution
 542        list_length = len(self.data)
 543
 544        if list_length == 0:
 545            avg_bondangle = 0
 546            avg_bondlength = 0
 547        else:
 548            total_bondangle = 0
 549            total_bondlength = 0
 550
 551            for ss in self.data:
 552                total_bondangle += ss.bond_angle_ideality
 553                total_bondlength += ss.bond_length_ideality
 554
 555            avg_bondangle = total_bondangle / list_length
 556            avg_bondlength = total_bondlength / list_length
 557
 558        print(f"DisulfideList: {name}")
 559        print(f"Length: {list_length}")
 560        print(f"Average energy: {avg_energy:.2f} kcal/mol")
 561        print(f"Average CA distance: {avg_distance:.2f} Å")
 562        print(f"Average Resolution: {avg_resolution:.2f} Å")
 563        print(f"Bond angle deviation: {avg_bondangle:.2f}°")
 564        print(f"Bond length deviation: {avg_bondlength:.2f} Å")
 565
 566    def display(self, style="sb", light="Auto", panelsize=512):
 567        """
 568        Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.
 569
 570        :param single: Display the bond in a single panel in the specific style.
 571        :param style:  Rendering style: One of:\n
 572            - 'sb' - split bonds
 573            - 'bs' - ball and stick
 574            - 'cpk' - CPK style
 575            - 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
 576            - 'plain' - boring single color
 577        :light: If True, light background, if False, dark
 578        """
 579        # from proteusPy.utility import get_theme
 580
 581        pid = self.pdb_id
 582        ssbonds = self.data
 583        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number off ssbonds
 584        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
 585        winsize = (panelsize * cols, panelsize * rows)
 586
 587        avg_enrg = self.average_energy
 588        avg_dist = self.average_distance
 589        resolution = self.average_resolution
 590
 591        if light == "light":
 592            pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 593        elif light == "dark":
 594            pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 595        else:
 596            _theme = get_theme()
 597            if _theme == "light":
 598                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 599            elif _theme == "dark":
 600                pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 601                _logger.info("Dark mode detected.")
 602            else:
 603                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 604
 605        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), Avg E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Avg Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
 606
 607        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(rows, cols))
 608        pl = self._render(pl, style)
 609        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 610        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
 611        pl.link_views()
 612        pl.reset_camera()
 613        pl.show()
 614
 615    def display_torsion_statistics(
 616        self,
 617        display=True,
 618        save=False,
 619        fname="ss_torsions.png",
 620        theme="auto",
 621    ):
 622        """
 623        Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.
 624
 625        :param display: Whether to display the plot in the notebook. Default is True.
 626        :type display: bool
 627        :param save: Whether to save the plot as an image file. Default is False.
 628        :type save: bool
 629        :param fname: The name of the image file to save. Default is 'ss_torsions.png'.
 630        :type fname: str
 631        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot. Default is 'Auto'. Options are 'Auto', 'light', and 'dark'.
 632        :type theme: str
 633        :return: none
 634        """
 635
 636        if self.length == 0:
 637            _logger.warning("Empty DisulfideList. Nothing to display.")
 638            return
 639
 640        set_plotly_theme(theme)
 641        title = f"{self.id}: {self.length} members"
 642
 643        tor_vals, dist_vals = self.calculate_torsion_statistics()
 644
 645        tor_mean_vals = tor_vals.loc["mean"]
 646        tor_std_vals = tor_vals.loc["std"]
 647
 648        dist_mean_vals = dist_vals.loc["mean"]
 649        dist_std_vals = dist_vals.loc["std"]
 650
 651        fig = make_subplots(
 652            rows=2, cols=2, vertical_spacing=0.125, column_widths=[1, 1]
 653        )
 654
 655        fig.update_layout(
 656            title={
 657                "text": title,
 658                "xanchor": "center",
 659                # 'y':.9,
 660                "x": 0.5,
 661                "yanchor": "top",
 662            },
 663            width=1024,
 664            height=1024,
 665        )
 666
 667        fig.add_trace(
 668            go.Bar(
 669                x=["X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "X5"],
 670                y=tor_mean_vals[:5],
 671                name="Torsion Angle (°) ",
 672                error_y=dict(type="data", array=tor_std_vals, visible=True),
 673            ),
 674            row=1,
 675            col=1,
 676        )
 677
 678        fig.add_trace(
 679            go.Bar(
 680                x=["rho"],
 681                y=[dist_mean_vals[4]],
 682                name="ρ (°)",
 683                error_y=dict(type="data", array=[dist_std_vals[4]], visible=True),
 684            ),
 685            row=1,
 686            col=1,
 687        )
 688
 689        # Update the layout of the subplot
 690        # Cα N, Cα, Cβ, C', Sγ Å °
 691
 692        fig.update_yaxes(
 693            title_text="Dihedral Angle (°)", range=[-200, 200], row=1, col=1
 694        )
 695        fig.update_yaxes(range=[0, 320], row=2, col=2)
 696
 697        # Add another subplot for the mean values of energy
 698        fig.add_trace(
 699            go.Bar(
 700                x=["Strain Energy (kcal/mol)"],
 701                y=[dist_mean_vals[3]],
 702                name="Energy (kcal/mol)",
 703                error_y=dict(
 704                    type="data",
 705                    array=[dist_std_vals[3].tolist()],
 706                    width=0.25,
 707                    visible=True,
 708                ),
 709            ),
 710            row=1,
 711            col=2,
 712        )
 713        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=1, col=2)
 714
 715        # Update the layout of the subplot
 716        # fig.update_xaxes(title_text="Energy", row=1, col=2)
 717        fig.update_yaxes(
 718            title_text="kcal/mol", range=[0, 20], row=1, col=2
 719        )  # max possible DSE
 720
 721        # Add another subplot for the mean values of ca_distance
 722        fig.add_trace(
 723            go.Bar(
 724                x=["Cα Distance (Å)", "Cβ Distance (Å)", "Sγ Distance (Å)"],
 725                y=[dist_mean_vals[0], dist_mean_vals[1], dist_mean_vals[2]],
 726                name="Distances (Å)",
 727                error_y=dict(
 728                    type="data",
 729                    array=[
 730                        dist_std_vals[0].tolist(),
 731                        dist_std_vals[1].tolist(),
 732                        dist_std_vals[2].tolist(),
 733                    ],
 734                    width=0.25,
 735                    visible=True,
 736                ),
 737            ),
 738            row=2,
 739            col=1,
 740        )
 741        # Update the layout of the subplot
 742        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Distance (A)", range=[0, 10], row=2, col=1)  #
 743        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=1)
 744
 745        # Add a scatter subplot for torsion length column
 746        fig.add_trace(
 747            go.Bar(
 748                x=["Torsion Length (Å)"],
 749                y=[tor_mean_vals[5]],
 750                name="Torsion Length, (Å)",
 751                error_y=dict(
 752                    type="data", array=[tor_std_vals[5]], width=0.25, visible=True
 753                ),
 754            ),
 755            row=2,
 756            col=2,
 757        )
 758        # Update the layout of the subplot
 759        fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Torsion Length", range=[0, 350], row=2, col=2)
 760        fig.update_traces(width=0.25, row=2, col=2)
 761
 762        # Update the error bars
 763        fig.update_traces(
 764            error_y_thickness=2,
 765            error_y_color="gray",
 766            texttemplate="%{y:.2f} ± %{error_y.array:.2f}",
 767            textposition="outside",
 768        )  # , row=1, col=1)
 769
 770        if display:
 771            fig.show()
 772
 773        if save:
 774            fig.write_image(Path(fname))
 775
 776        return
 777
 778    @property
 779    def distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 780        """
 781        Build and return the distance dataframe for the input list.
 782        This can take considerable time for the entire list.
 783
 784        :return: Dataframe containing the Cα-Cα distances for the given list.
 785
 786        Example:
 787        >>> from proteusPy import Disulfide, Load_PDB_SS, DisulfideList
 788        >>> PDB_SS = Load_PDB_SS()
 789
 790        """
 791        return self.build_distance_df()
 792
 793    def display_overlay(
 794        self,
 795        screenshot=False,
 796        movie=False,
 797        verbose=False,
 798        fname="ss_overlay.png",
 799        light="Auto",
 800    ):
 801        """
 802        Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
 803        a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides
 804        at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.
 805
 806        :param screenshot: Save a screenshot, defaults to False
 807        :param movie: Save a movie, defaults to False
 808        :param verbose: Verbosity, defaults to True
 809        :param fname: Filename to save for the movie or screenshot, defaults to 'ss_overlay.png'
 810        :param light: Background color, defaults to True for White. False for Dark.
 811        """
 812
 813        # from proteusPy.utility import get_theme
 814
 815        pid = self.pdb_id
 816
 817        ssbonds = self.data
 818        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number off ssbonds
 819        avg_enrg = self.average_energy
 820        avg_dist = self.average_distance
 821        resolution = self.average_resolution
 822
 823        res = 64
 824
 825        if tot_ss > 30:
 826            res = 48
 827        if tot_ss > 60:
 828            res = 16
 829        if tot_ss > 90:
 830            res = 8
 831
 832        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), Avg E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Avg Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
 833
 834        if light == "light":
 835            pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 836        elif light == "dark":
 837            pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 838        else:
 839            _theme = get_theme()
 840            if _theme == "light":
 841                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 842            elif _theme == "dark":
 843                pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
 844                _logger.info("Dark mode detected.")
 845            else:
 846                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
 847
 848        if movie:
 849            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=True)
 850        else:
 851            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
 852
 853        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
 854        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
 855        # pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
 856        pl.add_axes()
 857
 858        mycol = np.zeros(shape=(tot_ss, 3))
 859        mycol = get_jet_colormap(tot_ss)
 860
 861        # scale the overlay bond radii down so that we can see the individual elements better
 862        # maximum 90% reduction
 863
 864        brad = BOND_RADIUS if tot_ss < 10 else BOND_RADIUS * 0.75
 865        brad = brad if tot_ss < 25 else brad * 0.8
 866        brad = brad if tot_ss < 50 else brad * 0.8
 867        brad = brad if tot_ss < 100 else brad * 0.6
 868
 869        # print(f'Brad: {brad}')
 870        if verbose:
 871            pbar = tqdm(range(tot_ss), ncols=PBAR_COLS)
 872        else:
 873            pbar = range(tot_ss)
 874
 875        for i, ss in zip(pbar, ssbonds):
 876            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
 877            ss._render(
 878                pl,
 879                style="plain",
 880                bondcolor=color,
 881                translate=False,
 882                bond_radius=brad,
 883                res=res,
 884            )
 885
 886        pl.reset_camera()
 887
 888        if screenshot:
 889            pl.show(auto_close=False)  # allows for manipulation
 890            # Take the screenshot after ensuring the plotter is still active
 891            try:
 892                pl.screenshot(fname)
 893                if verbose:
 894                    print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved image to: {fname}")
 895            except RuntimeError as e:
 896                _logger.error("Error saving screenshot: %s", e)
 897
 898        elif movie:
 899            if verbose:
 900                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 901
 902            pl.open_movie(fname)
 903            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
 904            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
 905            pl.close()
 906
 907            if verbose:
 908                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}")
 909        else:
 910            pl.show()
 911
 912        return
 913
 914    def extend(self, other):
 915        """
 916        Extend the Disulfide list with other.
 917
 918        :param other: extension
 919        :type item: DisulfideList
 920        """
 921
 922        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
 923            self.data.extend(other)
 924        else:
 925            self.data.extend(self.validate_ss(item) for item in other)
 926
 927    def filter_by_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 2.0):
 928        """
 929        Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Ca distance and
 930        the minimum, which defaults to 2.0A.
 931
 932        :param distance: Distance in Å
 933        :param minimum: Distance in Å
 934        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
 935        """
 936
 937        reslist = []
 938        sslist = self.data
 939
 940        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
 941        if distance == -1.0:
 942            return sslist.copy()
 943
 944        reslist = [
 945            ss
 946            for ss in sslist
 947            if ss.ca_distance < distance and ss.ca_distance > minimum
 948        ]
 949
 950        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by distance < {distance:.2f}")
 951
 952    def filter_by_sg_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 1.0):
 953        """
 954        Return a DisulfideList filtered by to between the maxium Sg distance and
 955        the minimum, which defaults to 1.0A.
 956
 957        :param distance: Distance in Å
 958        :param minimum: Distance in Å
 959        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.
 960        """
 961
 962        reslist = []
 963        sslist = self.data
 964
 965        # if distance is -1.0, return the entire list
 966        if distance == -1.0:
 967            return sslist.copy()
 968
 969        reslist = [
 970            ss
 971            for ss in sslist
 972            if ss.sg_distance < distance and ss.sg_distance > minimum
 973        ]
 974
 975        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by Sγ distance < {distance:.2f}")
 976
 977    def filter_by_bond_ideality(self, angle: float = -1.0):
 978        """
 979        Return a DisulfideList filtered by bond angle ideality between the maxium angle
 980        and the minimum, which defaults to 0.0°.
 981
 982        :param angle: Angle in degrees
 983        :param minimum: Angle in degrees
 984        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given angle.
 985        """
 986
 987        reslist = []
 988        sslist = self.data
 989
 990        # if angle is -1.0, return the entire list
 991        if angle == -1.0:
 992            return sslist.copy()
 993
 994        reslist = [ss for ss in sslist if ss.bond_angle_ideality < angle]
 995
 996        return DisulfideList(reslist, f"filtered by bond angle < {angle:.2f}")

 998    def get_by_name(self, name):
 999        """
1000        Returns the Disulfide with the given name from the list.
1001        """
1002        for ss in self.data:
1003            if ss.name == name:
1004                return ss.copy()  # or ss.copy() !!!
1005        return None

1007    def get_chains(self):
1008        """
1009        Return the chain IDs for chains within the given Disulfide.
1010        :return: Chain IDs for given Disulfide
1011        """
1012
1013        res_dict = {"xxx"}
1014        sslist = self.data
1015
1016        for ss in sslist:
1017            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
1018            dchain = ss.distal_chain
1019            res_dict.update(pchain)
1020            res_dict.update(dchain)
1021
1022        res_dict.remove("xxx")
1023
1024        return res_dict

1026    def get_torsion_array(self):
1027        """
1028        Return a 2D NumPy array representing the dihedral angles in the given disulfide list.
1029
1030        :return: A 2D NumPy array of shape (n, 5), where n is the number of disulfide bonds in the list. Each row
1031                of the array represents the dihedral angles of a disulfide bond, in the following order:
1032                [X1, X, X3, X4, X5], where i is the index of the disulfide bond in the list.
1033        """
1034        return np.array([ss.torsion_array for ss in self.data])

1036    def has_chain(self, chain) -> bool:
1037        """
1038        Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide, False otherwise.
1039        :return: Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide, False otherwise.
1040        """
1041
1042        chns = {"xxx"}
1043        chns = self.get_chains()
1044        if chain in chns:
1045            return True
1046        else:
1047            return False

1093    def translate(self, translation_vector) -> None:
1094        """
1095        Translate the DisulfideList by the given translation vector.
1096        Note: The translation is a vector SUBTRACTION, not addition.
1097        This is used primarily to move a list to its geometric center of mass
1098        and is a destructive operation, in the sense that it updates the list in place.
1099
1100        :param translation_vector: The translation vector to apply.
1101        :type translation_vector: Vector3D
1102        """
1103        for ss in self.data:
1104            ss.translate(translation_vector)

1108        Insert a Disulfide into the list at the specified index
1109
1110        :param index: insertion point
1111        :type index: int
1112        :param item: Disulfide to insert
1113        :type item: Disulfide
1114        """
1115        self.data.insert(index, self.validate_ss(item))

1122    @property
1123    def min(self) -> Disulfide:
1124        """
1125        Return Disulfide from the list with the minimum energy
1126
1127        :return: Disulfide with the minimum energy.
1128        """
1129        sslist = sorted(self.data)
1130        return sslist[0]

1132    @property
1133    def max(self) -> Disulfide:
1134        """
1135        Return Disulfide from the list with the maximum energy
1136
1137        :return: Disulfide with the maximum energy. This assumes that
1138        the comparison is based on the energy attribute.
1139        """
1140        sslist = sorted(self.data)
1141        return sslist[-1]

1143    def minmax_distance(self):
1144        """
1145        Return the Disulfides with the minimum and
1146        maximum Cα distances in the list.
1147
1148        :return: SSmin, SSmax
1149        """
1150        sslist = self.data
1151
1152        if not sslist:
1153            return None, None
1154
1155        ssmin = min(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
1156        ssmax = max(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.ca_distance)
1157
1158        return ssmin, ssmax
1159
1160    @property
1161    def minmax_energy(self):
1162        """
1163        Return the Disulfides with the minimum and maximum energies
1164        from the DisulfideList.
1165
1166        :return: Disulfides with minimum and maximum energies
1167        """
1168        sslist = self.data
1169
1170        if not sslist:
1171            return None, None
1172
1173        sslist = sorted(sslist, key=lambda ss: ss.energy)
1174        return sslist[0], sslist[-1]

1176    def nearest_neighbors(self, cutoff: float, *args):
1177        """
1178        Return all Disulfides within the given angle cutoff of the input Disulfide.
1179
1180        :param cutoff: Distance cutoff, degrees
1181        :param args: Either 5 individual angles (chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5) or a list of 5 angles
1182        :return: DisulfideList of neighbors within the cutoff
1183        """
1184        if len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], list) and len(args[0]) == 5:
1185            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args[0]
1186        elif len(args) == 5:
1187            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args
1188        else:
1189            raise ValueError(
1190                "You must provide either 5 individual angles or a list of 5 angles."
1191            )
1192
1193        sslist = self.data
1194        modelss = proteusPy.Disulfide("model", torsions=[chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5])
1195        res = modelss.torsion_neighbors(sslist, cutoff)
1196
1197        resname = f"Neighbors within {cutoff:.2f}° of [{', '.join(f'{angle:.2f}' for angle in modelss.dihedrals)}]"
1198        res.pdb_id = resname
1199
1200        return res
1201
1202    def nearest_neighbors_ss(self, ss, cutoff: float):
1203        """
1204        Return the list of Disulfides within the torsional cutoff
1205        of the input Disulfide.
1206
1207        :param ss: Disulfide to compare to
1208        :param cutoff: Distance cutoff, degrees
1209        :return: DisulfideList of neighbors
1210        """
1211
1212        sslist = self.data
1213        res = ss.torsion_neighbors(sslist, cutoff)
1214
1215        resname = f"{ss.name} neighbors within {cutoff}°"
1216        res.pdb_id = resname
1217
1218        return res

1246    def validate_ss(self, value):
1247        """Return the Disulfide object if it is a Disulfide, otherwise raise an error"""
1248        from proteusPy.Disulfide import Disulfide
1249
1250        if value is None:
1251            raise ValueError("The value cannot be None.")
1252
1253        if not isinstance(value, Disulfide):
1254            raise TypeError("The value must be an instance of Disulfide.")
1255        return value

1257    def create_deviation_dataframe(self, verbose=False):
1258        """
1259        Create a DataFrame with columns PDB_ID, SS_Name, Angle_Deviation, Distance_Deviation,
1260        Ca Distance from a list of disulfides.
1261
1262        :param verbose: Whether to display a progress bar.
1263        :type verbose: bool
1264        :return: DataFrame containing the disulfide information.
1265        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
1266        """
1267        disulfide_list = self.data
1268        data = {
1269            "PDB_ID": [],
1270            "Resolution": [],
1271            "SS_Name": [],
1272            "Angle_Deviation": [],
1273            "Bondlength_Deviation": [],
1274            "Ca_Distance": [],
1275            "Sg_Distance": [],
1276        }
1277
1278        if verbose:
1279            pbar = tqdm(disulfide_list, desc="Processing...", leave=False)
1280        else:
1281            pbar = disulfide_list
1282
1283        for ss in pbar:
1284            data["PDB_ID"].append(ss.pdb_id)
1285            data["Resolution"].append(ss.resolution)
1286            data["SS_Name"].append(ss.name)
1287            data["Angle_Deviation"].append(ss.bond_angle_ideality)
1288            data["Bondlength_Deviation"].append(ss.bond_length_ideality)
1289            data["Ca_Distance"].append(ss.ca_distance)
1290            data["Sg_Distance"].append(ss.sg_distance)
1291
1292        df = pd.DataFrame(data)
1293        return df
1294
1295    def extract_distances(self, distance_type="sg", flip=False, cutoff=-1):
1296        """
1297        Extract and filter the distance values from the disulfide list based on the specified type and comparison.
1298
1299        :param disulfide_list: List of disulfide objects.
1300        :param distance_type: Type of distance to extract ('sg' or 'ca').
1301        :param flip: If true, return distances greater than the cutoff value.
1302        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for filtering distances.
1303        :return: List of filtered distance values.
1304        """
1305        disulfide_list = self.data
1306        distances = filtered_distances = []
1307
1308        match distance_type:
1309            case "sg":
1310                distances = [ds.sg_distance for ds in disulfide_list]
1311            case "ca":
1312                distances = [ds.ca_distance for ds in disulfide_list]
1313            case _:
1314                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
1315
1316        if cutoff == -1.0:
1317            return distances
1318
1319        if flip:
1320            filtered_distances = [d for d in distances if d > cutoff]
1321        else:
1322            filtered_distances = [d for d in distances if d <= cutoff]
1323
1324        return filtered_distances
1325
1326    def plot_distances(
1327        self, distance_type="sg", cutoff=-1, flip=False, theme="auto", log=True
1328    ):
1329        """
1330        Plot the distance values as a histogram using plotly express.
1331
1332        :param distances: List of distance values.
1333        :param distance_type: Type of distance to plot ('sg' or 'ca').
1334        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for the x-axis title.
1335        :param flip: Whether to flip the comparison in the x-axis title.
1336        :param theme: The plotly theme to use. Default is 'auto', which will use the current system theme.
1337        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis. Default is True.
1338        """
1339
1340        set_plotly_theme(theme)
1341        cmp_str = "less" if not flip else "greater"
1342
1343        distances = self.extract_distances(distance_type, cmp_str, cutoff)
1344        yaxis_type = "log" if log else "linear"
1345
1346        match distance_type:
1347            case "sg":
1348                column_name = "SG Distance"
1349                title = "Sγ Distance Distribution"
1350                if cutoff == -1.0:
1351                    xtitle = "Sγ-Sγ Distances, (no cutoff)"
1352                else:
1353                    xtitle = (
1354                        f"Sγ Distance < {cutoff} Å"
1355                        if not flip
1356                        else f"Sγ-Sγ Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
1357                    )
1358            case "ca":
1359                column_name = "Ca Distance"
1360                title = "Cα Distance Distribution"
1361                if cutoff == -1.0:
1362                    xtitle = "Cα-Cα Distances, (no cutoff)"
1363                else:
1364                    xtitle = (
1365                        f"Cα Distance < {cutoff} Å"
1366                        if not flip
1367                        else f"Cα-Cα Distance >= {cutoff} Å"
1368                    )
1369            case _:
1370                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
1371
1372        # Convert to a Pandas DataFrame with the appropriate column name
1373        df = pd.DataFrame(distances, columns=[column_name])
1374
1375        fig = px.histogram(
1376            df,
1377            x=column_name,  # Use the column name for the x-axis
1378            nbins=NBINS,
1379            title=title,
1380        )
1381        fig.update_layout(
1382            title={"text": "Distance Distribution", "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
1383            xaxis_title=xtitle,
1384            yaxis_title="Frequency",
1385            yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
1386            bargap=0.2,
1387        )
1388        fig.show()
1389
1390    def plot_deviation_histograms(self, verbose=False, theme="auto", log=True) -> None:
1391        """
1392        Plot histograms for Bondlength_Deviation, Angle_Deviation, and Ca_Distance.
1393
1394        This function creates and displays histograms for the bond length deviation,
1395        bond angle deviation from the disulfide list. The histograms
1396        are displayed on a logarithmic scale for the y-axis.
1397
1398        :param verbose: Whether to display a progress bar.
1399        :type verbose: bool
1400        :param theme: The plotly theme to use. Default is 'auto', which will use the current system theme.
1401        :param log: Whether to use a logarithmic scale for the y-axis. Default is True.
1402        """
1403
1404        set_plotly_theme(theme)
1405        if log:
1406            yaxis_type = "log"
1407        else:
1408            yaxis_type = "linear"
1409
1410        df = self.create_deviation_dataframe(verbose=verbose)
1411
1412        fig = px.histogram(
1413            df,
1414            x="Bondlength_Deviation",
1415            nbins=NBINS,
1416            title="Bond Length Deviation (Å)",
1417        )
1418
1419        fig.update_layout(
1420            title={"text": "Bond Length Deviation", "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
1421            xaxis_title="Bond Length Deviation (Å)",
1422            yaxis_title="Frequency",
1423            yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
1424        )
1425        fig.show()
1426
1427        fig2 = px.histogram(
1428            df, x="Angle_Deviation", nbins=NBINS, title="Bond Angle Deviation, (°)"
1429        )
1430        fig2.update_layout(
1431            title={"text": "Bond Angle Deviation", "x": 0.5, "xanchor": "center"},
1432            xaxis_title="Bond Angle Deviation (°)",
1433            yaxis_title="Frequency",
1434            yaxis_type=yaxis_type,
1435        )
1436
1437        fig2.show()
1438
1439        return

1441    def filter_deviation_df_by_cutoffs(
1442        self,
1443        length_cutoff=10.0,
1444        angle_cutoff=100.0,
1445        ca_cutoff=1000.0,
1446        sg_cutoff=10.0,
1447        minimum_distance=0.0,
1448    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
1449        """
1450        Filter the DataFrame based on bond length, angle, Ca and Sg distance cutoffs.
1451
1452        Note: The default values are set to high values to allow all structures to pass the filter.
1453
1454        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviations.
1455        :type df: pd.DataFrame
1456        :param length_cutoff: Cutoff value for Bond Length Deviation.
1457        :type distance_cutoff: float
1458        :param angle_cutoff: Cutoff value for angle deviation.
1459        :type angle_cutoff: float
1460        :param ca_cutoff: Cutoff value for Ca distance.
1461        :type ca_cutoff: float
1462        :param sg_cutoff: Cutoff value for Sg distance.
1463        :type sg_cutoff: float
1464        :return: Filtered DataFrame.
1465        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
1466        """
1467        df = self.create_deviation_dataframe()
1468
1469        filtered_df = df[
1470            (df["Bondlength_Deviation"] <= length_cutoff)
1471            & (df["Angle_Deviation"] <= angle_cutoff)
1472            & (df["Ca_Distance"] >= minimum_distance)
1473            & (df["Ca_Distance"] <= ca_cutoff)
1474            & (df["Sg_Distance"] >= minimum_distance)
1475            & (df["Sg_Distance"] <= sg_cutoff)
1476        ]
1477        return filtered_df
1478
1479    def bad_filter_deviation_df_by_cutoffs(
1480        self,
1481        length_cutoff=0.0,
1482        angle_cutoff=0.0,
1483        ca_cutoff=0.0,
1484        sg_cutoff=0.0,
1485        minimum_distance=0.0,
1486    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
1487        """
1488        Return the DataFrame objects that are GREATER than the cutoff based on distance,
1489        angle, Ca and Sg distance cutoffs. Used to get the bad structures.
1490
1491        Note: The default values are set to low values to allow all structures to pass the filter.
1492
1493        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviations.
1494        :type df: pd.DataFrame
1495        :param length_cutoff: Cutoff value for Bond Length Deviation.
1496        :type length_cutoff: float
1497        :param angle_cutoff: Cutoff value for angle deviation.
1498        :type angle_cutoff: float
1499        :param ca_cutoff: Cutoff value for Ca distance.
1500        :type ca_cutoff: float
1501        :return: Filtered DataFrame.
1502        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
1503        """
1504        df = self.create_deviation_dataframe()
1505
1506        filtered_df = df[
1507            (df["Bondlength_Deviation"] > length_cutoff)
1508            & (df["Angle_Deviation"] > angle_cutoff)
1509            & (df["Ca_Distance"] > ca_cutoff)
1510            & (df["Ca_Distance"] < minimum_distance)
1511            & (df["Sg_Distance"] > sg_cutoff)
1512            & (df["Sg_Distance"] < minimum_distance)
1513        ]
1514        return filtered_df
1515
1516    def calculate_torsion_statistics(self) -> tuple:
1517        """
1518        Calculate and return the torsion and distance statistics for the DisulfideList.
1519
1520        This method builds a DataFrame containing torsional parameters, Cα-Cα distance,
1521        energy, and phi-psi angles for the DisulfideList. It then calculates the mean
1522        and standard deviation for the torsional and distance parameters.
1523
1524        :return: A tuple containing two DataFrames:
1525                - tor_stats: DataFrame with mean and standard deviation for torsional parameters.
1526                - dist_stats: DataFrame with mean and standard deviation for distance parameters.
1527        :rtype: tuple (pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame)
1528        """
1529
1530        df = self.torsion_df
1531
1532        tor_cols = ["chi1", "chi2", "chi3", "chi4", "chi5", "torsion_length"]
1533        dist_cols = ["ca_distance", "cb_distance", "sg_distance", "energy", "rho"]
1534        tor_stats = {}
1535        dist_stats = {}
1536
1537        def circular_mean(series):
1538            """
1539            Calculate the circular mean of a series of angles.
1540
1541            This function converts the input series of angles from degrees to radians,
1542            computes the mean of the sine and cosine of these angles, and then converts
1543            the result back to degrees.
1544
1545            :param series: A sequence of angles in degrees.
1546            :type series: array-like
1547            :return: The circular mean of the input angles in degrees.
1548            :rtype: float
1549            """
1550            radians = np.deg2rad(series)
1551            sin_mean = np.sin(radians).mean()
1552            cos_mean = np.cos(radians).mean()
1553            return np.rad2deg(np.arctan2(sin_mean, cos_mean))
1554
1555        for col in tor_cols[:5]:
1556            tor_stats[col] = {"mean": circular_mean(df[col]), "std": df[col].std()}
1557
1558        tor_stats["torsion_length"] = {
1559            "mean": df["torsion_length"].mean(),
1560            "std": df["torsion_length"].std(),
1561        }
1562
1563        for col in dist_cols:
1564            dist_stats[col] = {"mean": df[col].mean(), "std": df[col].std()}
1565
1566        tor_stats = pd.DataFrame(tor_stats, columns=tor_cols)
1567        dist_stats = pd.DataFrame(dist_stats, columns=dist_cols)
1568
1569        return tor_stats, dist_stats
1570
1571    # class ends

The class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects. Indexing and slicing are supported, as well as typical list operations like .insert(), .append() and .extend(). The DisulfideList object must be initialized with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name. Sorting is keyed by torsional energy.

The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the
[display()](#DisulfideList.display) and [display_overlay()](#DisulfideList.display_overlay)methods.
See below for examples.


Examples:
>>> from proteusPy import Disulfide, DisulfideLoader, DisulfideList, Load_PDB_SS

Instantiate some variables. Note: the list is initialifzed with an iterable and a name (optional)

>>> SS = Disulfide('tmp')

The list is initialized with an iterable, a name and resolution. Name and resolution
are optional.
>>> SSlist = DisulfideList([],'ss', -1.0)

Load the database.
>>> PDB_SS = Load_PDB_SS(verbose=False, subset=True)

Get the first disulfide via indexing.
>>> SS = PDB_SS[0]

# assert str(SS) == "<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>"

>>> SS4yys = PDB_SS['4yys']

# assert str(SS4yys) == "[<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>, <Disulfide 4yys_56A_98A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>, <Disulfide 4yys_156A_207A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å>]"

Make some empty disulfides.
>>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
>>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')

Make a DisulfideList containing ss1, named 'tmp'
>>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1], 'tmp')
>>> sslist.append(ss2)

Extract the first disulfide
>>> ss1 = PDB_SS[0]

# assert str(ss1.pprint_all()) == "<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A, Source: 4yys, Resolution: 1.35 Å

Proximal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 22, ' '))> Distal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 65, ' '))> Proximal Coordinates: N: Cα: C: O: Cβ: Sγ: Cprev Nnext: Distal Coordinates: N: Cα: C: O: Cβ: Sγ: Cprev Nnext: Proximal Internal Coords: N: Cα: C: O: Cβ: Sγ: Cprev Nnext: Distal Internal Coords: N: Cα: C: O: Cβ: Sγ: Cprev Nnext: Χ1-Χ5: 174.63°, 82.52°, -83.32°, -62.52° -73.83°, 138.89°, 1.70 kcal/mol Cα Distance: 4.50 Å Torsion length: 231.53 deg>"

Get a list of disulfides via slicing

Display the subset disulfides overlaid onto the same coordinate frame,
(proximal N, Ca, C').

The disulfides are colored individually to facilitate inspection.

>>> subset.display_overlay()
DisulfideList(iterable, pid: str = 'nil', res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False) 
163    def __init__(self, iterable, pid: str = "nil", res=-1.0, quiet=True, fast=False):
164        """
165        Initialize the DisulfideList.
166
167        :param iterable: An iterable of disulfide bonds.
168        :type iterable: iterable
169        :param pid: Name for the list, default is "nil".
170        :type pid: str
171        :param res: Resolution, default is -1.0. If -1, the average resolution is used.
172        :type res: float
173        :param quiet: If True, suppress output, default is True.
174        :type quiet: bool
175        :param fast: If True, enable fast mode, default is False.
176        :type fast: bool
177
178        Example:
179        >>> from proteusPy import DisulfideList, Disulfide
180
181        Initialize some empty disulfides.
182        >>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
183        >>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')
184        >>> ss3 = Disulfide('ss3')
185
186        Make a list containing the disulfides.
187        >>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1, ss2], 'sslist')
188        >>> sslist
189        [<Disulfide ss1, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss2, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>]
190        >>> sslist.append(ss3)
191        >>> sslist
192        [<Disulfide ss1, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss2, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>, <Disulfide ss3, Source: 1egs, Resolution: -1.0 Å>]
193        """
194
195        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
196
197        self.pdb_id = pid
198        self.quiet = quiet
199
200        if not fast:
201            if res == -1:
202                self._res = self.average_resolution
203            else:
204                self._res = res
205        else:
206            self._res = res

277        """

average_distance 
290    @property
291    def average_distance(self):
292        """
293        Return the Average distance (Å) between the atoms in the list.
294
295        :return: Average distance (Å) between all atoms in the list
296
297        """
298        sslist = self.data
299        cnt = 1
300
301        total = 0.0
302        for ss1 in sslist:
303            for ss2 in sslist:
304                if ss2 == ss1:
305                    continue
306                total += ss1.Distance_RMS(ss2)
307                cnt += 1
308
309        return total / cnt

def build_distance_df(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
395    def build_distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
396        """
397        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList Cα-Cα and Sg-Sg distances, energy.
398        This can take several minutes for the entire database.
399
400        :return: DataFrame containing Ca distances
401        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
402        """
403        # create a list to collect rows as dictionaries
404        rows = []
405        i = 0
406        sslist = self.data
407        total_length = len(sslist)
408        update_interval = max(1, total_length // 20)  # 5% of the list length
409
410        if self.quiet:
411            pbar = sslist
412        else:
413            pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=PBAR_COLS, leave=False)
414
415        for ss in pbar:
416            new_row = {
417                "source": ss.pdb_id,
418                "ss_id": ss.name,
419                "proximal": ss.proximal,
420                "distal": ss.distal,
421                "energy": ss.energy,
422                "ca_distance": ss.ca_distance,
423                "cb_distance": ss.cb_distance,
424                "sg_distance": ss.sg_distance,
425            }
426            rows.append(new_row)
427            i += 1
428
429            if not self.quiet:
430                if i % update_interval == 0 or i == total_length - 1:
431                    pbar.update(update_interval)
432
433        # create the dataframe from the list of dictionaries
434        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=Distance_DF_Cols)
435
436        return SS_df

def build_torsion_df(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
440    def build_torsion_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
441        """
442        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList torsional parameters,
443        Cα-Cα and Sg-Sg distances, energy, and phi-psi angles. This can take several minutes for the
444        entire database.
445
446        :return: pd.DataFrame containing the torsions
447        """
448        # create a list to collect rows as dictionaries
449        rows = []
450        i = 0
451        total_length = len(self.data)
452        update_interval = max(1, total_length // 20)  # 5% of the list length
453
454        sslist = self.data
455        if self.quiet:
456            pbar = sslist
457        else:
458            pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=PBAR_COLS, leave=False)
459
460        for ss in pbar:
461            new_row = {
462                "source": ss.pdb_id,
463                "ss_id": ss.name,
464                "proximal": ss.proximal,
465                "distal": ss.distal,
466                "chi1": ss.chi1,
467                "chi2": ss.chi2,
468                "chi3": ss.chi3,
469                "chi4": ss.chi4,
470                "chi5": ss.chi5,
471                "energy": ss.energy,
472                "ca_distance": ss.ca_distance,
473                "cb_distance": ss.cb_distance,
474                "sg_distance": ss.sg_distance,
475                "psi_prox": ss.psiprox,
476                "phi_prox": ss.phiprox,
477                "phi_dist": ss.phidist,
478                "psi_dist": ss.psidist,
479                "torsion_length": ss.torsion_length,
480                "rho": ss.rho,
481            }
482            rows.append(new_row)
483            i += 1
484
485            if not self.quiet:
486                if i % update_interval == 0 or i == total_length - 1:
487                    pbar.update(update_interval)
488
489        if not self.quiet:
490            pbar.close()
491
492        # create the dataframe from the list of dictionaries
493        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=Torsion_DF_Cols)

def by_chain(self, chain: str): 
497    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
498        """
499        Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier.
500
501        :param chain: chain identifier, 'A', 'B, etc
502        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides within that chain.
503        """
504

507

511            if pchain == dchain:
512                if pchain == chain:

514            else:
515                print(f"Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:")

def describe(self): 
531    def describe(self):
532        """
533        Prints out relevant attributes of the given disulfideList.
534
535        :param disulfideList: A list of disulfide objects.
536        :param list_name: The name of the list.
537        """
538        name = self.pdb_id
539        avg_distance = self.average_ca_distance
540        avg_energy = self.average_energy
541        avg_resolution = self.average_resolution
542        list_length = len(self.data)
543
544        if list_length == 0:
545            avg_bondangle = 0
546            avg_bondlength = 0
547        else:
548            total_bondangle = 0
549            total_bondlength = 0
550
551            for ss in self.data:
552                total_bondangle += ss.bond_angle_ideality
553                total_bondlength += ss.bond_length_ideality
554
555            avg_bondangle = total_bondangle / list_length
556            avg_bondlength = total_bondlength / list_length
557
558        print(f"DisulfideList: {name}")
559        print(f"Length: {list_length}")
560        print(f"Average energy: {avg_energy:.2f} kcal/mol")
561        print(f"Average CA distance: {avg_distance:.2f} Å")
562        print(f"Average Resolution: {avg_resolution:.2f} Å")
563        print(f"Bond angle deviation: {avg_bondangle:.2f}°")
564        print(f"Bond length deviation: {avg_bondlength:.2f} Å")

568        Display the Disulfide list in the specific rendering style.

571        :param style:  Rendering style: One of:\n
572            - 'sb' - split bonds
573            - 'bs' - ball and stick
574            - 'cpk' - CPK style
575            - 'pd' - Proximal/Distal style - Red=proximal, Green=Distal
576            - 'plain' - boring single color
577        :light: If True, light background, if False, dark
578        """
579        # from proteusPy.utility import get_theme
580
581        pid = self.pdb_id
582        ssbonds = self.data
583        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number off ssbonds
584        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
585        winsize = (panelsize * cols, panelsize * rows)
586
587        avg_enrg = self.average_energy
588        avg_dist = self.average_distance
589        resolution = self.average_resolution
590
591        if light == "light":
592            pv.set_plot_theme("document")
593        elif light == "dark":
594            pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
595        else:
596            _theme = get_theme()
597            if _theme == "light":
598                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
599            elif _theme == "dark":
600                pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
601                _logger.info("Dark mode detected.")
602            else:
603                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
604

608        pl = self._render(pl, style)

def display_torsion_statistics( self, display=True, save=False, fname='ss_torsions.png', theme='auto'): 
615    def display_torsion_statistics(
616        self,
617        display=True,
618        save=False,
619        fname="ss_torsions.png",
620        theme="auto",
621    ):
622        """
623        Display torsion and distance statistics for a given Disulfide list.
624
625        :param display: Whether to display the plot in the notebook. Default is True.
626        :type display: bool
627        :param save: Whether to save the plot as an image file. Default is False.
628        :type save: bool
629        :param fname: The name of the image file to save. Default is 'ss_torsions.png'.
630        :type fname: str
631        :param theme: The theme to use for the plot. Default is 'Auto'. Options are 'Auto', 'light', and 'dark'.
632        :type theme: str
633        :return: none
634        """
635
636        if self.length == 0:
637            _logger.warning("Empty DisulfideList. Nothing to display.")
638            return
639
640        set_plotly_theme(theme)
641        title = f"{self.id}: {self.length} members"
642
643        tor_vals, dist_vals = self.calculate_torsion_statistics()
644
645        tor_mean_vals = tor_vals.loc["mean"]
646        tor_std_vals = tor_vals.loc["std"]

662            },

664            height=1024,
665        )

679            go.Bar(

686            col=1,
687        )

690        # Cα N, Cα, Cβ, C', Sγ Å °

def display_overlay( self, screenshot=False, movie=False, verbose=False, fname='ss_overlay.png', light='Auto'): 
793    def display_overlay(
794        self,
795        screenshot=False,
796        movie=False,
797        verbose=False,
798        fname="ss_overlay.png",
799        light="Auto",
800    ):
801        """
802        Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
803        a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides
804        at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.
805
806        :param screenshot: Save a screenshot, defaults to False
807        :param movie: Save a movie, defaults to False
808        :param verbose: Verbosity, defaults to True
809        :param fname: Filename to save for the movie or screenshot, defaults to 'ss_overlay.png'
810        :param light: Background color, defaults to True for White. False for Dark.
811        """
812
813        # from proteusPy.utility import get_theme
814
815        pid = self.pdb_id
816
817        ssbonds = self.data
818        tot_ss = len(ssbonds)  # number off ssbonds
819        avg_enrg = self.average_energy
820        avg_dist = self.average_distance
821        resolution = self.average_resolution
822
823        res = 64
824
825        if tot_ss > 30:
826            res = 48
827        if tot_ss > 60:
828            res = 16
829        if tot_ss > 90:
830            res = 8
831
832        title = f"<{pid}> {resolution:.2f} Å: ({tot_ss} SS), Avg E: {avg_enrg:.2f} kcal/mol, Avg Dist: {avg_dist:.2f} Å"
833
834        if light == "light":
835            pv.set_plot_theme("document")
836        elif light == "dark":
837            pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
838        else:
839            _theme = get_theme()
840            if _theme == "light":
841                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
842            elif _theme == "dark":
843                pv.set_plot_theme("dark")
844                _logger.info("Dark mode detected.")
845            else:
846                pv.set_plot_theme("document")
847
848        if movie:
849            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=True)
850        else:
851            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
852
853        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
854        pl.enable_anti_aliasing("msaa")
855        # pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
856        pl.add_axes()
857
858        mycol = np.zeros(shape=(tot_ss, 3))
859        mycol = get_jet_colormap(tot_ss)
860
861        # scale the overlay bond radii down so that we can see the individual elements better
862        # maximum 90% reduction
863
864        brad = BOND_RADIUS if tot_ss < 10 else BOND_RADIUS * 0.75
865        brad = brad if tot_ss < 25 else brad * 0.8
866        brad = brad if tot_ss < 50 else brad * 0.8
867        brad = brad if tot_ss < 100 else brad * 0.6
868
869        # print(f'Brad: {brad}')
870        if verbose:
871            pbar = tqdm(range(tot_ss), ncols=PBAR_COLS)
872        else:
873            pbar = range(tot_ss)
874
875        for i, ss in zip(pbar, ssbonds):
876            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
877            ss._render(
878                pl,
879                style="plain",
880                bondcolor=color,
881                translate=False,
882                bond_radius=brad,
883                res=res,
884            )
885
886        pl.reset_camera()
887
888        if screenshot:
889            pl.show(auto_close=False)  # allows for manipulation
890            # Take the screenshot after ensuring the plotter is still active
891            try:
892                pl.screenshot(fname)
893                if verbose:
894                    print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved image to: {fname}")
895            except RuntimeError as e:
896                _logger.error("Error saving screenshot: %s", e)
897
898        elif movie:
899            if verbose:
900                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}")
901
902            pl.open_movie(fname)
903            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
904            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
905            pl.close()
906
907            if verbose:
908                print(f" -> display_overlay(): Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}")
909        else:
910            pl.show()
911
912        return

Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.

Parameters

927    def filter_by_distance(self, distance: float = -1.0, minimum: float = 2.0):
928        """

930        the minimum, which defaults to 2.0A.
931
932        :param distance: Distance in Å
933        :param minimum: Distance in Å
934        :return: DisulfideList containing disulfides with the given distance.

937        reslist = []

948        ]

def translate(self, translation_vector) -> None: 
1093    def translate(self, translation_vector) -> None:
1094        """
1095        Translate the DisulfideList by the given translation vector.
1096        Note: The translation is a vector SUBTRACTION, not addition.
1097        This is used primarily to move a list to its geometric center of mass
1098        and is a destructive operation, in the sense that it updates the list in place.
1099
1100        :param translation_vector: The translation vector to apply.
1101        :type translation_vector: Vector3D
1102        """
1103        for ss in self.data:
1104            ss.translate(translation_vector)

Translate the DisulfideList by the given translation vector. Note: The translation is a vector SUBTRACTION, not addition. This is used primarily to move a list to its geometric center of mass and is a destructive operation, in the sense that it updates the list in place.

Parameters
  • translation_vector: The translation vector to apply.

def nearest_neighbors(self, cutoff: float, *args): 
1176    def nearest_neighbors(self, cutoff: float, *args):
1177        """
1178        Return all Disulfides within the given angle cutoff of the input Disulfide.
1179
1180        :param cutoff: Distance cutoff, degrees
1181        :param args: Either 5 individual angles (chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5) or a list of 5 angles
1182        :return: DisulfideList of neighbors within the cutoff
1183        """
1184        if len(args) == 1 and isinstance(args[0], list) and len(args[0]) == 5:
1185            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args[0]
1186        elif len(args) == 5:
1187            chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5 = args
1188        else:
1189            raise ValueError(
1190                "You must provide either 5 individual angles or a list of 5 angles."
1191            )
1192
1193        sslist = self.data
1194        modelss = proteusPy.Disulfide("model", torsions=[chi1, chi2, chi3, chi4, chi5])
1195        res = modelss.torsion_neighbors(sslist, cutoff)
1196
1197        resname = f"Neighbors within {cutoff:.2f}° of [{', '.join(f'{angle:.2f}' for angle in modelss.dihedrals)}]"
1198        res.pdb_id = resname
1199
1200        return res

def extract_distances(self, distance_type='sg', flip=False, cutoff=-1): 
1295    def extract_distances(self, distance_type="sg", flip=False, cutoff=-1):
1296        """
1297        Extract and filter the distance values from the disulfide list based on the specified type and comparison.
1298
1299        :param disulfide_list: List of disulfide objects.
1300        :param distance_type: Type of distance to extract ('sg' or 'ca').
1301        :param flip: If true, return distances greater than the cutoff value.
1302        :param cutoff: Cutoff value for filtering distances.
1303        :return: List of filtered distance values.
1304        """
1305        disulfide_list = self.data
1306        distances = filtered_distances = []
1307
1308        match distance_type:
1309            case "sg":
1310                distances = [ds.sg_distance for ds in disulfide_list]
1311            case "ca":
1312                distances = [ds.ca_distance for ds in disulfide_list]
1313            case _:
1314                raise ValueError("Invalid distance_type. Must be 'sg' or 'ca'.")
1315
1316        if cutoff == -1.0:
1317            return distances
1318
1319        if flip:
1320            filtered_distances = [d for d in distances if d > cutoff]
1321        else:
1322            filtered_distances = [d for d in distances if d <= cutoff]
1323
1324        return filtered_distances

def filter_deviation_df_by_cutoffs( self, length_cutoff=10.0, angle_cutoff=100.0, ca_cutoff=1000.0, sg_cutoff=10.0, minimum_distance=0.0) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1441    def filter_deviation_df_by_cutoffs(
1442        self,
1443        length_cutoff=10.0,
1444        angle_cutoff=100.0,
1445        ca_cutoff=1000.0,
1446        sg_cutoff=10.0,
1447        minimum_distance=0.0,
1448    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
1449        """
1450        Filter the DataFrame based on bond length, angle, Ca and Sg distance cutoffs.
1451
1452        Note: The default values are set to high values to allow all structures to pass the filter.
1453
1454        :param df: DataFrame containing the deviations.
1455        :type df: pd.DataFrame
1456        :param length_cutoff: Cutoff value for Bond Length Deviation.
1457        :type distance_cutoff: float
1458        :param angle_cutoff: Cutoff value for angle deviation.
1459        :type angle_cutoff: float
1460        :param ca_cutoff: Cutoff value for Ca distance.
1461        :type ca_cutoff: float
1462        :param sg_cutoff: Cutoff value for Sg distance.
1463        :type sg_cutoff: float
1464        :return: Filtered DataFrame.
1465        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
1466        """
1467        df = self.create_deviation_dataframe()
1468
1469        filtered_df = df[
1470            (df["Bondlength_Deviation"] <= length_cutoff)
1471            & (df["Angle_Deviation"] <= angle_cutoff)
1472            & (df["Ca_Distance"] >= minimum_distance)
1473            & (df["Ca_Distance"] <= ca_cutoff)
1474            & (df["Sg_Distance"] >= minimum_distance)
1475            & (df["Sg_Distance"] <= sg_cutoff)
1476        ]
1477        return filtered_df
